Savage Attacks.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

Illrigger.name: Illrigger
Illrigger.description:
The archdevils who rule the Seven Cities of Hell scheme endlessly. Each eternally plots to bring the others to heel—to ascend to the Throne of Hell, unite the Seven Cities and every infernal being living there, and lead an inexhaustible army of devils across the timescape until all worlds burn.

These archdevils' elite operatives are the illriggers. Knights, assassins, mages, and terror commandos of Hell, illriggers command the battlefield, disrupt enemy factions, and carry out their archdevil's infernal will.

em3tYVZIfmP29KFJ.hint: You gain proficiency with Constitution and Charisma saving throws.

ZzpHNvNvUMXxekUO.hint: You gain proficiency with light armor, medium armor, and shields.

lvHIhrld5UvH4QVp.hint: You gain proficiency with simple and martial weapons.

Multiclass Proficiencies.title: Multiclass Proficiencies
Multiclass Proficiencies.hint:
If Illrigger isn't your initial
                        class, here are the proficiencies you gain when you
                        take your first level as an Illrigger: light armor, medium
                        armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.

Forked Tongue: Infernal.title: Forked Tongue: Infernal
Forked Tongue: Infernal.hint: You can instinctively speak, read, and write Infernal.

Forked Tongue: Additional Languages.title: Forked Tongue: Additional Languages
Forked Tongue: Additional Languages.hint: You can speak two other languages of your choice, but you can't read or write them.

Forked Tongue: Additional Language.title: Forked Tongue: Additional Language
Forked Tongue: Additional Language.hint: You can speak one additional language of your choice, but you can't read or write them.

Maximum Seals.title: Maximum Seals
Maximum Seals.hint: The amount of Seals you can place on a creature before resting.

Interdict Boons.title: Interdict Boons
Interdict Boons.hint: You learn one interdict boon of your choice. As you gain levels in this class, you gain additional boons of your choice, as shown in the Interdict Boons column of the Illriger table. Whenever you gain an illrigger level, you can choose a boon you know and replace it with another boon you can learn.

Diabolic Contract.title: Diabolic Contract
Diabolic Contract.hint: You sign a diabolic contract with an archdevil who welcomes you into the Order of Desolation. Choose between the Architect of Ruin (Asmodeus), Hellspeaker (Moloch), Painkiller (Dispater), Sanguine Knight (Sutekh), or Shadowmaster (Belial) as your archdevil. Each of these subclasses is detailed after the class's description. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

Combat Mastery.title: Combat Mastery
Combat Mastery.hint: Your archdevil grants you uncanny skill in a certain form of combat. Choose one of the following illrigger combat masteries:

Infernal Conduit Dice.title: Infernal Conduit Dice
Infernal Conduit Dice.hint: The amount of infernal conduit dice you have.

Baleful Interdict.name: Baleful Interdict
Baleful Interdict.description:
You gain the ability to censure creatures with the power of Hell. Once on your turn, you can place a magical seal on a creature within 30 feet of you. You can either place this seal when you hit that target with a weapon attack (no action required), or you can use a bonus action to place this seal on a target you can see within range. This seal lasts for 1 minute or until burned (see “Burning Seals” below). A creature with one or more of your seals is referred to as an interdicted creature. Seals you place are invisible to other creatures, and when you can see an interdicted creature, the seals appear to you as glowing glyphs on the creature's body.

You can only place a limited number of seals before resting, and you regain all seals when you finish a short or long rest. The number of seals you can place increases as you gain illrigger levels, as indicated in the Seals column of the Illrigger table.

If an interdicted creature dies, you can use a bonus action on your turn to move all seals placed on them to a new creature you can see within 30 feet of them. Each seal's duration continues to elapse when an interdicted creature dies and when that seal is moved to a new creature.

Burning Seals. When an interdicted creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage from any source other than a seal burned by an illrigger, you can burn any number of seals you placed on them to deal 1d6 fire or necrotic damage (your choice) to that creature per seal burned. You deal this damage immediately after the triggering damage. Burning a seal doesn't require an action from you, but you can't do so while incapacitated. Once a seal is burned, it immediately vanishes

Once you reach 5th level in this class, your connection to your archdevil strengthens. Each burned seal deals an extra 1d6 damage, for a total of 2d6. The damage of each seal increases again by 1d6 when you reach 11th level (for a total of 3d6) and 20th level (for a total of 4d6) in this class, as indicated in the Seal Damage column of the Illrigger table.

Interdict Save. Class features you gain later can add additional effects to your Baleful Interdict and require your target to make a saving throw to resist them . The saving throw DC for these effects uses your interdict save DC, which is calculated as follows:

Interdict save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Burn Seals.name: Burn Seals
Burn Seals.condition: When an interdicted creature within range takes damage from any source other than a seal burned by an illrigger.

Interdiction Seal.name: Interdiction Seal
Interdiction Seal.description: An invisible infernal seal has been placed upon your body, and lasts for one minute.

Forked Tongue.name: Forked Tongue
Forked Tongue.description:
You can instinctively speak, read, and write Infernal.

In addition, you can speak two other languages of your choice, but you can't read or write them . When you finish a long rest, you can draw on your archdevil's knowledge to replace one of these two languages . When you do, choose another language whose name you know; you magically forget the previous language and gain this new one instead . Once you replace a language in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

Starting at 9th level, this feature grants you another language, for a total of three (in addition to Infernal) . Furthermore, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the intentions or sincerity of creatures.

Combat Mastery.name: Combat Mastery
Combat Mastery.description:
Your archdevil grants you uncanny skill in a certain form of combat. Choose one of the following illrigger combat masteries:

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.5DhsGwzumrgULn3D]{Bravado}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.iC849FaM1qEcsvV7]{Brutal}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.hC3BMF52g5QjfKxL]{Inexorable}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.CTeYV3PUGDZdP3ul]{Lies}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.K2GedFKNoZ4u99qX]{Lissome}

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.rfvnJR01Cvra80Ux]{Unfettered}

Interdiction.name: Interdiction
Interdiction.description:
You can infuse your seals with hellish magical power, enhancing their effects.

Interdict Boons Known . You learn one interdict boon of your choice from the “Interdict Boons” section at the end of the class's description . As you gain levels in this class, you gain additional boons of your choice, as shown in the Interdict Boons column of the Illrigger table. Each new boon must be of a level you can learn. When you reach 7th level, for example, you learn one new boon of 2nd or 7th level.

Whenever you gain an illrigger level, you can choose a boon you know and replace it with another boon you can learn.

Using Interdict Boons. Some boons allow you to expend unplaced seals to fuel abilities, while others empower all your seals or grant you benefits against interdicted creatures.

The boons that grant passive (or “always on”) benefits, such as the 2nd-level Swift Retribution boon, are marked with a “Passive” tag. You don't need to expend a seal or take an action to benefit from the passive boons you know. All other boons, such as the 2nd-level Abating Seal boon, must be activated on a turn (for example, by expending a seal). You can activate only one non-passive boon per turn, regardless of how many you know.

Brutal.name: Brutal
Brutal.description: When you hit a creature who is no more than one size larger than you with an attack you make with a melee weapon you are wielding with two hands, you can move the target 5 feet horizontally. If you choose, you can then spend your movement to move into the space they left.

Abating Seal.name: Abating Seal
Abating Seal.description: When a creature you can see damages you or an ally within 30 feet of you, you can expend a seal as a reaction to reduce the damage taken by the target by an amount equal to 1d10 + half of your illrigger level (rounded down).

Abate Harm.name: Abate Harm
Abate Harm.condition: When a creature you can see damages you or an ally within 30 feet of you,

Diabolic Contract.name: Diabolic Contract
Diabolic Contract.description: You sign a diabolic contract with an archdevil who welcomes you into the Order of Desolation. Choose between the Architect of Ruin (Asmodeus), Hellspeaker (Moloch), Painkiller (Dispater), Sanguine Knight (Sutekh), or Shadowmaster (Belial) as your archdevil. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

Invoke Hell.name: Invoke Hell
Invoke Hell.description:
Your diabolic connection allows you to channel infernal energy to empower magical effects. Your chosen diabolic contract grants you two Invoke Hell options and describes how to use each.

When you use your Invoke Hell, you choose which option to use. You must then finish a short or long rest to use your Invoke Hell again.

Some Invoke Hell effects require a saving throw. When you use such an effect, the DC equals your interdict save DC.

Painkiller.name: Painkiller
Painkiller.description:
The heavily armored death troopers of Hell, Painkillers serve Dispater, leading from the front of every major infernal battle.

Dispater rules Dis, the City of War. When Hell invades another world, Dispater's army does the fighting and dying. His Painkillers are master strategists who lead from the front, inspiring terror and awe in their soldiers. The imperious Painkillers are full of pride and hubris, and they often obsess over their personal appearance.

Though among the most chivalrous of the illriggers, a Painkiller's gallantry is twisted. They accept and honor challenges to single combat, and swiftly punish any who try to interfere—but if losing, they don't hesitate to cheat, and if winning, they arrogantly toy with an enemy before finishing them.

In a moment of weakness or desperation, a ruler in another world might see their army facing certain defeat and call on Dispater. Ever eager to sow strife and discord, Dispater often responds to these pleas by sending a Painkiller to lead the desperate ruler's armies.

Precepts of Pride

Dispater's heavy shock troops must be effective battlefield commanders and quickly dispatch enemies. Painkillers follow precepts instructing them to lead Hell's armies and wage war against Good across the timescape.

Lead from the Front. I charge in at the front of every battle, inspiring my soldiers and terrifying my enemies.

Commander. Wherever I go, I command. I don't take orders from those who don't have the will to lead.

Victory at Any Cost. I respect the enemy leader and treat them honorably. But once swords are drawn, I use every trick in my arsenal to win, expecting them to do the same.

Soldiers Die. I care not for the lives of my soldiers, for they are resources I spend to secure my victory.

Dispater's Blessing.title: Dispater's Blessing
Dispater's Blessing.hint: When Dispater accepts you as his illrigger, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.

Dispater's Blessing.name: Dispater's Blessing
Dispater's Blessing.description: When Dispater accepts you as his illrigger, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.

Devastator.name: Devastator
Devastator.description:
As an action, you invoke the authority of Dispater. You make a weapon attack and choose a number of willing creatures up to your proficiency bonus who you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature you choose can use a reaction to make a weapon attack or cast a damage-dealing cantrip with a casting time of 1 action.

Once you use this action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Invoke Hell: Grand Strategist.name: Invoke Hell: Grand Strategist
Invoke Hell: Grand Strategist.description: You can order your allies to follow your formation (no action required). Choose one or more creatures within 60 feet of you who can hear you, up to a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus. Each target can immediately move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Invoke Hell: Punishment.name: Invoke Hell: Punishment
Invoke Hell: Punishment.description:
When a creature damages you with an attack, you can use your reaction to force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker takes necrotic damage equal to the damage they dealt you with the triggering attack. On a successful save, the attacker takes half as much damage.

Foundry Note

When using the Save activity on this feature, you can input the amount of damage dealt by the triggering creature.

save.condition: When a creature damages you with an attack.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Dungeoneer's Pack.name: Dungeoneer's Pack
Dungeoneer's Pack.description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Waterskin.name: Waterskin
Waterskin.description: A leather hide sewn into an enclosed skin which can contain up to 4 pints of liquid. It weighs 5 pounds when full; a pint of water is approximately 1 pound.

Rations.name: Rations
Rations.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Crowbar.name: Crowbar
Crowbar.description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

Hempen Rope (50 ft.).name: Hempen Rope (50 ft.)
Hempen Rope (50 ft.).description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Torch.name: Torch
Torch.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

Tinderbox.name: Tinderbox
Tinderbox.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Piton.name: Piton
Piton.description: A metal spike that is drive into a seam in a climbing surface with a climbing hammer. It can also be used like iron spikes to block doors in a pinch.

Hammer.name: Hammer
Hammer.description: A tool with a heavy metal head mounted at the end of its handle, used for jobs such as breaking things and driving in nails.

Javelin.name: Javelin
Javelin.description: This light and flexible spear is designed for throwing, but is versatile enough to be used in melee combat as well.

Greatsword.name: Greatsword
Greatsword.description: A mighty two-handed blade is over four feet long an almost five inches wide. This weapon requires extensive martial training but those proficient in its use are formidable warriors.

Mace.name: Mace
Mace.description: A heavy metal head mounted to the end of a sturdy haft meant to deliver powerful, crushing blows capable of shattering armor and bone alike.

Rusty Shattered Blade.name: Rusty Shattered Blade
Rusty Shattered Blade.description: A rusted blade that has been shattered into multiple pieces, and wrapped in a simple cloth.

Dark Insignia.name: Dark Insignia
Dark Insignia.description: A shard of dark iron, blackened by hellfire. The sigil of your commander is inscribed onto it.

War Journal.name: War Journal
War Journal.description: A journal detailing your past assignments and missions.

Infernal Legionnaire.name: Infernal Legionnaire
Infernal Legionnaire.description:
• Skill Proficiencies: Athletics, Perception
  • Tool Proficiencies: Any artisan's tool, one gaming set
  • Equipment: A dark iron insignia depicting your commander's sigil, a set of fine clothes, a journal detailing your past assignments and missions, and the blade of a rusty shattered sword.

Infernal Legionnaire: Skill Proficiencie.title: Infernal Legionnaire: Skill Proficiencies
Infernal Legionnaire: Skill Proficiencie.hint: You gain proficiency with the Athletics and Perception skills.

Infernal Legionnaire: Tool Proficiencies.title: Infernal Legionnaire: Tool Proficiencies
Infernal Legionnaire: Tool Proficiencies.hint: You gain proficiency with playing cards.

Signature Attack (Dagger).name: Signature Attack (Dagger)
Signature Attack (Dagger).description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Beginning at 7th level, the agent can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

Samurko (Human Beastheart).name: Samurko (Human Beastheart)
Samurko (Human Beastheart).description: As wild as their trusty @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.actors.Actor.f4L7LTQ5HMS7FFoL]{Owlbear Companion}, Samurko is as much beast as their companion Hoot is. Living on the outskirts of civilization until he manages to find anyone accepting of Hoot and him to travel with.

Beastheart.name: Beastheart
Beastheart.description: A beastheart is an adventurer who forms a bond of friendship with a wild creature, and who draws power from that bond as it strengthens over time. Working as a team, a beastheart and their faithful companion can take on even the most dangerous adventures, challenging any monsters and overcoming any obstacles.

1Oqv4lEAiFRJ4YGF.hint: You gain proficiency with Strength and Wisdom saving throws.

gKWdMHxUYlZFMc8d.hint: You gain proficiency with light armor, medium armor, and shields.

MbTBzVMftotkVVNE.hint: You gain proficiency with simple weapons, battleaxes, greataxes, longbows, nets, scimitars, and shortswords.

Primal Exploits.title: Primal Exploits
Primal Exploits.hint: You learn three primal exploits of your choice, detailed below. You learn two additional exploits of your choice at 10th and 17th level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the primal exploits you know and replace it with another primal exploit, for which you must have the appropriate beastheart level.

Companion Bond.title: Companion Bond
Companion Bond.hint: At 3rd level, you choose a specialized bond that you share with your companion.  Choose Ferocious Bond, Hunter Bond, Infernal Bond, Primordial Bond, or Protector Bond. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

Master Caregiver: Animal Handling.title: Master Caregiver: Animal Handling
Master Caregiver: Animal Handling.hint: Also at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Animal Handling skill. If you already have proficiency in Animal Handling, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with the skill.

Loyal to the End: Charmed & Frightened I.title: Loyal to the End: Charmed & Frightened Immunity
Loyal to the End: Charmed & Frightened I.hint: You and your companion can't be charmed or frightened.

Primal Exploit Damage Scaling.title: Primal Exploit Damage Scaling
Primal Exploit Damage Scaling.hint: Scaling Damage for Furious Vengeance & Crushing Charge

Companion.name: Companion
Companion.description:
At 1st level, you gain a companion creature that accompanies you on your adventures, fighting, exploring, and living alongside you. You can choose any companion in this supplement or other MCDM supplements. The @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.books.JournalEntry.mcdmcbbeastheart.JournalEntryPage.00tesbeastheart0#companions]{Companions} section has information on fifteen companion creatures you can choose for your beastheart, and information on the rules for using companions (including ferocity and entering a rampage).

Your supernatural connection to your companion binds their life to yours, allowing you to help your companion overcome even the most grievous injuries. If your companion has lost hit points or is dead, you can spend 1 minute meditating on your companion's spirit. The companion then regains all their hit points and returns to life if they were dead, and you gain one level of exhaustion. If the companion's body was destroyed, they reform within 5 feet of you.

Foundry Note

When you gain a companion when taking a level in Beastheart, you can grant your companion the @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.OH0gz82nD3wiOTfr]{Beastheart Companion} subclass in order to grant them features such as "Beyond Instinct" and "Loyal to the End" at appropriate levels.

Additionally, you can go into the "Place Companion" and "Revive Companion" activities on this item and link your companion to it, allowing you to summon it when you use this feature.

Natural Language.name: Natural Language
Natural Language.description:
From 1st level, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with your companion, as well as with all Beasts and Monstrosities. This feature doesn't allow you to communicate complex thoughts or questions, but you can make simple statements (such as showing other creatures you mean them no harm) or ask simple questions (such as the location of the nearest body of water, or if a specific individual with a unique look passed through the area recently).

The knowledge and awareness of such creatures is limited by their intellect, and the GM determines if a particular creature is in a communicative mood. While speaking with a Beast or Monstrosity using this feature, you can make Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks in place of Charisma checks to influence the creature.

Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
Hide Armor.description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Sling.name: Sling
Sling.description: A flexible lash of leather affixed to a wooden handle which is capable of flinging rocks or metal bullets with deadly velocity.

Explorer's Pack.name: Explorer's Pack
Explorer's Pack.description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Tinderbox.name: Tinderbox
Tinderbox.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Torch.name: Torch
Torch.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

Bedroll.name: Bedroll
Bedroll.description: Roll of cloth used by traveller to sleep in.

Rations.name: Rations
Rations.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Hempen Rope (50 ft.).name: Hempen Rope (50 ft.)
Hempen Rope (50 ft.).description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Waterskin.name: Waterskin
Waterskin.description: A leather hide sewn into an enclosed skin which can contain up to 4 pints of liquid. It weighs 5 pounds when full; a pint of water is approximately 1 pound.

Mess Kit.name: Mess Kit
Mess Kit.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

Primal Exploits.name: Primal Exploits
Primal Exploits.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you learn to channel your companion's fury into extraordinary deeds called primal exploits, which are fueled by your companion's ferocity.

You learn three primal exploits of your choice, and learn an additional two exploits of your choice when you reach 10th and 17th level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can choose on of the primal exploits you know and replace it with another primal exploit, for which you must have the appropriate beastheart level.

Some exploits are activated using your reaction. Others are useable under specific circumstances but require no action. Some exploits are activated as part of the Attack action, in which case you can use only one such exploit per turn.

All exploits require you to spend your companion's ferocity to use them. Your companion must be within 60 feet of you when you use an exploit, and must have ferocity at least equal to the exploit's cost. The companion loses ferocity equal to the cost when you use the exploit. You can use an exploit even if your companion is &reference[unconscious apply=false], as long as they have the appropriate ferocity. You can't use an exploit while your companion has entered a rampage.

Some exploits allow a companion to make a signature attack. This signature attack can't be modified with additional exploits or used as part of a ferocity action.

Exploit Save DC

Some of your exploits require creatures to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Exploit save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Saving throws for your exploits use your exploit save DC even if the action that triggers the saving throw is undertaken by your companion.

Your exploit save DC also adjusts the DC of your companion's ferocity actions (see Superior Ferocity).

Superior Ferocity.name: Superior Ferocity
Superior Ferocity.description: Also at 2nd level, whenever your companion uses a ferocity action that requires a creature to make an ability check or saving throw, the companion can use your Primal Exploit save DC in place of the normal DC.

Aid Us, Friend (3 Ferocity).name: Aid Us, Friend (3 Ferocity)
Aid Us, Friend (3 Ferocity).description: You can activate this exploit whenever you take the Attack action. Before or after you attack, your companion can take the Help action as a bonus action.

utility.condition: When you take the Attack action.

Feral Reflexes (2 Ferocity).name: Feral Reflexes (2 Ferocity)
Feral Reflexes (2 Ferocity).description: When you or your companion is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to increase the target's AC by 2 against the triggering attack.

utility.condition: When you or your companion is hit by an attack.

Hurricane Blow (3 Ferocity).name: Hurricane Blow (3 Ferocity)
Hurricane Blow (3 Ferocity).description: You can activate this exploit whenever you take the Attack action. The first time you hit a creature with a weapon attack this turn, the attack deals its normal effects, and you can push the target up to 10 feet away from you.

utility.condition: When you take the Attack action.

Master Caregiver.name: Master Caregiver
Master Caregiver.description: Also at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Animal Handling skill. If you already have proficiency in Animal Handling, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with the skill.

Ferocious Bond.name: Ferocious Bond
Ferocious Bond.description: Some beasthearts and companions feel closest when they abandon all control and let instinct guide their every move. When your companion enters a rampage, you feel every moment of their brutality, inspiring you to a battle fury all your own.

Fury of the Wise: Intimidation.title: Fury of the Wise: Intimidation
Fury of the Wise: Intimidation.hint: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill if you do not already have it.

Fury of the Wise.name: Fury of the Wise
Fury of the Wise.description: Also at 3rd level, your experience with your companion's rage awes those who dare stand against you. You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill if you do not already have it. Additionally, your Charisma (Intimidation) checks gain a bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Fury of the Wise.name: Fury of the Wise
Fury of the Wise.description: You gain a bonus to Charisma (Intimidation) checks equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Frenzied Charge.name: Frenzied Charge
Frenzied Charge.description: Starting when you choose this bond at 3rd level, you learn to follow your companion's furious lead. Whenever your companion enters a rampage, you can use a reaction to move up to your speed and make a melee weapon attack against a target at the end of the movement.

utility.condition: When your companion enters a rampage.

Greataxe.name: Greataxe
Greataxe.description: This enormous axe features two twin crescent blades mounted on either side of a tall spiked shaft. Designed to be wielded with two hands and cleave foes in twain.

Maul.name: Maul
Maul.description: This heavy two-handed mace crushes metal and bone with thunderous force.

Wild One.name: Wild One
Wild One.description:
• Skill Proficiencies: Nature, Stealth
  • Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan's tools, drums
  • Equipment: A drum, ragged leather clothing, one artisan's tool of your choice, and a belt pouch containing 5 cp.

Pouch.name: Pouch
Pouch.description: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch. A pouch can hold up to ⅕ cubic foot or 6 pounds of gear.

Drum.name: Drum
Drum.description:
A drum, of any variety, to evoke awe, wonder, or fear in your audience.

If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus. Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

Woodcarver's Tools.name: Woodcarver's Tools
Woodcarver's Tools.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in woodcarving.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Human.name: Human
Human.description:
It's hard to make generalizations about humans, but your human character has these traits.

Ability Score Increase. Your ability scores each increase by 1.

Age. Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

Alignment. Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

Size. Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

dNSrZePZHz2qwVpi.hint: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Monstrous Companion.name: Monstrous Companion
Monstrous Companion.description: Companion creatures are designed to accompany player characters on adventures. If an NPC has a pet or creature servant, it is recommended that you use the creature's normal stat block. For instance, if an NPC ranger has an owlbear that they work with, that creature would use the normal Owlbear stat block and be played by the GM as normal. But if the characters are charged with rescuing a fallen druid NPC's owlbear pet from the clutches of a villain, the GM can choose to instead make that an owlbear companion, allowing the creature to join their rescuers and become part of subsequent adventures.

dhsmGiD5IRXme2j0.title: Companion Features
dhsmGiD5IRXme2j0.hint: Choose the type of breath weapon that matches the Draconic Lineage of your companion.

Gain Ferocity.name: Gain Ferocity
Gain Ferocity.condition: The companion isn't incapacitated at the start of their and their caregiver's turn

Spit Breath.name: Spit Breath
Spit Breath.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a signature attack as a ranged weapon attack, with a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, the attack deals an extra [[lookup @prof.flat]] damage, and all the damage dealt by the attack is of the type associated with the wyrmling's lineage instead of piercing damage.

Draconic Lineage.name: Draconic Lineage
Draconic Lineage.description:
The wyrmling has a lineage that determines a damage type to which they have immunity and which applies to the damage dealt by their Spit Breath and Breath Weapon actions. See the Draconic Lineages table for more information.

Shared Resistance.name: Shared Resistance
Shared Resistance.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s caregiver has resistance to the damage type associated with their Draconic Lineage, and takes no damage from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Breath Weapon action.

Foundry Note

The Active Effects on this feature can be applied to both the companion and the caregiver, granting them resistance to the appropriate damage type.

Signature Attack (Longsword).name: Signature Attack (Longsword)
Signature Attack (Longsword).description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Beginning at 7th level, the tyrant can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

Signature Attack (Hellfire).name: Signature Attack (Hellfire)
Signature Attack (Hellfire).description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +3 plus PB to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. [[/damage extended]]. Both of the spell's damage types increase by 1d4 when the deceiver reaches 5th level (2d4 each), 11th level (3d4 each), and 17th level (4d4 each).

Sacrificial Resistance.name: Sacrificial Resistance
Sacrificial Resistance.description: If [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. When she uses this trait, her [[/item kJ9MJepu2dtJaNlT]] doesn't function until the start of her next turn.

utility.condition: When Cthrion Uronziir fails a saving throw.

Supernatural Resilience.name: Supernatural Resilience
Supernatural Resilience.description: [[lookup @name]] has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other psionic and magical effects.

Ultimate Reflection.name: Ultimate Reflection
Ultimate Reflection.description: [[lookup @name]] creates a duplicate of herself that appears in an unoccupied space within 120 feet of her. The duplicate acts on her initiative immediately after she takes her turn. This duplicate has the same statistics as [[lookup @name]], except that they have 200 hit points and lack her Time Aura trait, her Cosmic Breath and Inhale actions, and her villain actions. The duplicate disappears when it or [[lookup @name]] is reduced to 0 hit points.

Broadcast.name: Broadcast
Broadcast.description:
You broadcast a telepathic message to every creature of your choice that can understand a language, and which is within a specific distance you choose within range. The message lasts for 1 minute, and can include images of events that you have personally witnessed. A creature that receives the message hears your words and sees the images in their mind, though they still maintain their own senses.

You can further refine the parameters for recipients based on creature kind (for example, the message could be sent only to Humanoids, or gnolls could be excluded from receiving the message) or creatures of a particular alignment (for example, the message could be sent only to good-aligned creatures, or lawful-aligned creatures could be excluded from receiving the message).

A creature that is on another plane of existence does not receive the message.

Increased Order. When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 to increase the range to 5 miles.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.7knK35LTZFodOIYY]{Broadcast} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Distant Voice.name: Distant Voice
Distant Voice.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or fewer to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if they know you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The power enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

You know the direction and distance to these locations, but not how to access them.

This power can target a specific creature known to you, or a creature you have seen within 30 feet of you at least once or whose detailed image you have seen (such as a professional portrait). If the creature you described or named is in a different form, such as being under the effect of a polymorph spell, this power doesn't locate the creature.

Distant Voice.name: Distant Voice
Distant Voice.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or fewer to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if they know you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The power enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Wpc0dTKd3uAI5G82]{Distant Voice} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Veritas.name: Veritas
Veritas.description:
You target up to three creatures you can see within range, each of which must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you know when the creature speaks, writes, or otherwise communicates a lie for the duration. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on their saving throw.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.PG3J9YnAafdaOwaP]{Veritas} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Veritas.name: Veritas
Veritas.description: Whenever you speak, write, or otherwise communicate a lie for the duration of this power, the creature that manifested this power knows you told a lie.

Make Friends.name: Make Friends
Make Friends.description:
You attempt to psionically charm a Humanoid you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. If they fail the saving throw, the target is &reference[charmed] by you for the duration or until you or your companions do anything harmful to them. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance, but this doesn't mean the creature will do whatever is asked of them. When the power ends, the creature knows they were charmed by you.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.7ePlcJsrX25UA1PY]{Make Friends} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Psionic Friend.name: Psionic Friend
Psionic Friend.description: For the next hour, you are &reference[charmed apply=false] by the creature that manifested this power. While charmed, you regard the creature as a friendly acquaintance but this doesn't mean that you must do whatever is asked of you. When this power ends, you know that you were charmed by them.

Dagger of the Mind.name: Dagger of the Mind
Dagger of the Mind.description:
You lash out with your mind to psychically damage a creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 6d10 psychic damage and can take only the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge actions on their next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and can take their turn normally.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.TIFu2wUE02jwliXE]{Dagger of the Mind} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Daggers of the Mind.name: Daggers of the Mind
Daggers of the Mind.description: During your next turn, you can only take the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge actions.

Harlequin.name: Harlequin
Harlequin.description:
You psionically grasp for control of the mind of one Humanoid you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. On a successful save, you can choose to deal 3d10 psychic damage to the target. On a failed save, the target is &reference[charmed] by you for the duration .

While the target is charmed in this way, you have a telepathic link with them as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the target (no action required), which they do their best to obey. If the target completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from you, they defend and preserve themself to the best of their ability.

You can use an action to take total and precise control of a charmed target. Until the end of your next turn, the target takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything else. During this time, you can also cause the target to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, they make a new Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw succeeds, the charmed condition ends.

Increased Order. When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 2 to target a creature other than a Humanoid.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.KSxCbHYSBVBLcWpx]{Harlequin} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Harlequin.name: Harlequin
Harlequin.description:
You are &reference[charmed apply=false] by the creature that manifested this power. While charmed, you share a telepathic link with them as long as t he two of you are on the same plane of existence. They can use this telepathic link to issue commands to you, which you must do your best to obey. If you complete an order and don't receive further directions from them, you defend and preserve yourself to the best of your ability.

Each time you take damage, you make a new Wisdom saving throw, ending this effect on a success.

Fracture.name: Fracture
Fracture.description:
You unleash a burst of psionic power at a point within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 psychic damage and is fractured for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't fractured. While fractured, a creature's speed is halved; they have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws; and attack rolls against them have advantage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.71xbImP4PGMMkgrn]{Fracture} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Fractured.name: Fractured
Fractured.description:
You are fractured for the next minute. While fractured, your speed is halved, you have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, and attacks against you have advantage.

At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on yourself on a success.

Share Pain.name: Share Pain
Share Pain.description:
You psionically reach out toward the creature that damaged you, letting them share your pain. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 2d12 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.t4JVzc1hgSr5MYUw]{Share Pain} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

activation.condition: In response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description:
Choose a creature within range that you can see. For the duration, you learn the surface thoughts of that creature—what is most on their mind in that moment. While reading the target's mind, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) checks made to assess or influence the target.

A creature that has an Intelligence of 3 or lower, or which doesn't speak any language, can't be targeted by this power.

Psionic Bolt.name: Psionic Bolt
Psionic Bolt.description:
You shoot forth a purple beam of psychic force to strike a creature or object in range. Make a ranged power attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 force damage, and if they are Large or smaller, they are pushed 5 feet away from you.

This attack's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

Time Thief.name: Time Thief
Time Thief.description:
You psionically absorb the life force of a creature within range, causing them to age faster than normal. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 1d4 necrotic damage and you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage taken.

This power's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

Again.name: Again
Again.description:
You momentarily rewind time, allowing the creature that made the triggering attack a second chance. That creature can reroll the attack and must use the new roll.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.jLdONGNb2aFkrJBG]{Again} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

activation.condition: When you or a creature within 30 feet of you misses with an attack.

Illuminator.name: Illuminator
Illuminator.description: You create a focused 30-foot cone of bright light, which has sharp edges and gives off no dim light. You can change the color of the light and can turn it on and off as you desire (no action required).

Illuminator.name: Illuminator
Illuminator.description: A 30-foot cone of bright light originates from you, which has sharp edges and gives off no dim light. You can change the color of the light and turn it on and off as you desire (no action required.)

Shared Thoughts.name: Shared Thoughts
Shared Thoughts.description:
You choose a creature within range that you are aware of and send them a telepathic message of up to twenty five words, or a single visual image that can include no more than twenty-five words. The target can then send a message of up to twenty-five words back to you before the start of your next turn.

Your telepathic message and its response can pass through solid objects, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks them. The messages don't have to follow a straight line, and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Extinguish.name: Extinguish
Extinguish.description:
Choose one creature, object, or psionic effect within range. Any power of 3rd order or lower on the target ends.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.bUKtjbjz8MGaEI8Q]{Extinguish} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Intuition.name: Intuition
Intuition.description:
You target up to three willing creatures within range, gifting them precognitive insight to help keep them safe. For the duration, each time a target takes damage, the damage is reduced by 1d4 (to a minimum 0 damage).

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.23GXAIk1LWC8HT81]{Intuition} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Intuition.name: Intuition
Intuition.description: You have been granted precognitive insight for the duration of this power. Each time you take damage while you are affected by this power, you reduce the damage you take by [[/r 1d4]] (to a minimum of 0 damage).

Memory Gap.name: Memory Gap
Memory Gap.description:
By manipulating time, you attempt to erase another creature's memories. One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. On a failure, you can erase the target's memory of an event that they experienced within the last 24 hours and that lasted no more than 10 minutes, permanently eliminating all memory of the event. You do not need to have witnessed the event, but must be aware of the event and its details in some way, even as a second-hand account. Once the memory is erased, the target can't recall what happened to them during that time, but they are unbothered by the hole in their recollection.

Any creature that can sense psionics, such as one under the influence of the sixth sense power, can tell the target has had their memory modified. The cure ailment power manifested on the target restores the creature's memory.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.VkJqUgtd2n5bz5PU]{Memory Gap} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Fickle Readiness.name: Fickle Readiness
Fickle Readiness.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] rolls initiative, they can switch the initiative count of two creatures they can see within 90 feet of them that rolled initiative at the same time as [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Witness Demise.name: Witness Demise
Witness Demise.description:
You project a mental image into the minds of up to three creatures you can see within range. Choose one of the following options, which affects all targets:

Future Demise. You show each target a possible death that they will experience far in the future, which is peaceful or heroic. For the duration, each target can't be &reference[frightened apply=false], and has advantage on saving throws.

Imminent Demise. You show each target a possible death that they will experience imminently, which is violent or terrible. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 8d8 psychic damage and is &reference[frightened] of you for the duration (save ends at end of turn). On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not frightened.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.wJvSjNKTHSdolyS9]{Witness Demise} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Future Demise.name: Future Demise
Future Demise.description: You have been shown a possible death you will experience far in the future, either peaceful or heroic. For the duration of this power, you can't be &reference[frightened apply=false] and have advantage on saving throws.

Imminent Demise.name: Imminent Demise
Imminent Demise.description:
You have been shown your imminent demise, and are &reference[frightened apply=false] for the duration of this power.

At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat your saving throw against this power, ending frightened condition on yourself on a success.

Restore the Past.name: Restore the Past
Restore the Past.description:
You touch a piece of a Large or smaller mundane object that has been destroyed, then remake that object with your mind. You can remake the object even if some of its broken pieces are missing, or if it has been reduced to dust by a disintegrate spell.

The object can have a value of no more than 1,000 gp. Once an object has been remade, this power can't be used to remake another version of the object even if you have other pieces of the original remaining.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.disaBgltbKSxb2Pv]{Restore the Past} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Reveal the Path.name: Reveal the Path
Reveal the Path.description:
When you manifest this power, you describe or name a creature that is familiar to you that has passed within 1,000 feet of your location in the last 24 hours. You instantly know every location the creature visited within the last 24 hours on the plane of existence where you manifested this power. You know the direction and distance to these locations, but not how to access them.

This power can target a specific creature known to you, or a creature you have seen within 30 feet of you at least once or whose detailed image you have seen (such as a professional portrait). Read Object.name: Read Object
Read Object.description:
You touch an object and gain the following information regarding it:

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

  • You see and hear any events that have occurred within 20 feet of the object within the last 8 hours, perceiving those events from the object's perspective.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.5dYeQREPcdG5YyA7]{Read Object} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Flame On.name: Flame On
Flame On.description: Melee or Ranged Power Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. [[/damage extended]] and any flammable object hit by the flame ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

Imbue Flame.name: Imbue Flame
Imbue Flame.description:
You touch a willing creature and imbue them with a spark of fiery psionic force. For the duration, the creature's weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.y5IFETLo6sTf3mlC]{Imbue Flame} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Imbued Flame.name: Imbued Flame
Imbued Flame.description: For the duration of this power, your weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Kindling.name: Kindling
Kindling.description:
You choose four Medium or smaller creatures or object within range, then psionically weaken the forms of the targets to make them more susceptible to fire. A target creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer the appropriate effect for the duration (a target object automatically suffers the effect):

  • If the target has immunity to fire damage, they have resistance to fire damage instead.

  • If the target has resistance to fire damage, they lose this damage resistance.

  • If the target has no immunity or resistance to fire damage, they have vulnerability to fire damage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.G6de3ZXsmQzdLhbl]{Kindling} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Kindling: Fire Resistance.name: Kindling: Fire Resistance
Kindling: Fire Resistance.description: For the duration of this power, your immunity to fire damage has been reduced to resistance to fire damage instead.

Kindling: Normal Fire Damage.name: Kindling: Normal Fire Damage
Kindling: Normal Fire Damage.description: For the duration of this power, your resistance to fire damage is negated.

Kindling: Fire Vulnerability.name: Kindling: Fire Vulnerability
Kindling: Fire Vulnerability.description: For the duration of this power, you have vulnerability to fire damage.

Scorch.name: Scorch
Scorch.description:
A pulse of fire forming a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Eq7IQdMB33wayZlp]{Scorch} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Fire Form.name: Fire Form
Fire Form.description:
You encase yourself in psionic flame and gain the following benefits for the duration:

  • You have a flying speed of 60 feet.

  • You have immunity to cold and fire damage.

  • Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you touches you for the first time on a turn or hits you with a melee attack, that creature takes 1d6 fire damage.

  • Your power attacks, weapon attacks, and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

  • You have a flying speed of 60 feet.

  • Your power attacks, weapon attacks, and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Crucible.name: Crucible
Crucible.description:
With the power of your mind, you ignite a 50-foot-square area that is 10 feet high and centered on a point on the ground that you can see within range. Each creature that starts their turn in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 7d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At the start of each of your turns while the power is in effect, you can cause the fire to spread out 5 feet on all sides (no action required), expanding the area over any surface except for nonflammable liquid.

The fire damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.4RO2LnU7ZFJCXJgh]{Crucible} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Flame's Master.name: Flame's Master
Flame's Master.description: You emit a burst of psionic energy that affects every Medium or smaller fire-based light source within range, allowing you to ignite a target light source or snuff it out, choosing individually for each source. Such light sources include campfires, candles, fireplaces, lanterns, oil lamps, torches, and the like, but don't include supernatural sources such as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.yiYCqmD5n08NftYk]{Sun Blade} or an object affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi] spell

Heat Shell.name: Heat Shell
Heat Shell.description:
A shimmering globe of heat extends out from you in a 10-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you and lasting for the duration. When you manifest this power, you can choose any number of creatures or objects that you can see within 60 feet of you to be unaffected by it.

Whenever a creature affected by this power touches the heat shell for the first time on a turn or starts their turn inside the globe or within 10 feet of its exterior, they take 4d8 fire damage. The shell prevents an affected creature from moving or reaching into or out of it, but all creatures can cast spells, manifest powers, or make attacks with ranged or reach weapons through the shell.

The heat shell ignites flammable objects it touches that aren't being worn or carried

Heat Shell Contact Damage.name: Heat Shell Contact Damage
Heat Shell Contact Damage.condition: Whenever a creature affected by this power touches the heat shell for the first time on a turn or starts their turn inside the globe or within 10 feet of its exterior.

Fold Space.name: Fold Space
Fold Space.description:
You bend space to create a one-way pathway to a destination you select, which lasts until the end of your next turn. The opening of the pathway is a 10-foot diameter circle that appears in an unoccupied space within range. Any creature that passes through the opening is transported to the destination.

The destination you choose can be on any plane of existence. It must be known to you, though you don't need to have visited it. The power fails if you select a destination that doesn't exist, such as a place you think you know that was actually an illusion, or a familiar location that has been destroyed.

Broadcast.name: Broadcast
Broadcast.description:
You broadcast a telepathic message to every creature of your choice that can understand a language, and which is within a specific distance you choose within range. The message lasts for 1 minute, and can include images of events that you have personally witnessed. A creature that receives the message hears your words and sees the images in their mind, though they still maintain their own senses.

You can further refine the parameters for recipients based on creature kind (for example, the message could be sent only to Humanoids, or gnolls could be excluded from receiving the message) or creatures of a particular alignment (for example, the message could be sent only to good-aligned creatures, or lawful-aligned creatures could be excluded from receiving the message).

A creature that is on another plane of existence does not receive the message.

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description:
You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

You touch a piece of a Large or smaller mundane object that has been destroyed, then remake that object with your mind. You can remake the object even if some of its broken pieces are missing, or if it has been reduced to dust by a disintegrate spell.

One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. If you sense psionics in this way, they can use an action to see a faint aura around each visible creature or object within 30 feet of them that bears psionic power. This sense can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Extinguish.name: Extinguish
Extinguish.description:
Choose one creature, object, or psionic effect within range. Any power of 3rd order or lower on the target ends.

Monstrous Companion.name: Monstrous Companion
Monstrous Companion.description: Companion creatures are designed to accompany player characters on adventures. If an NPC has a pet or creature servant, it is recommended that you use the creature's normal stat block. For instance, if an NPC ranger has an owlbear that they work with, that creature would use the normal Owlbear stat block and be played by the GM as normal. But if the characters are charged with rescuing a fallen druid NPC's owlbear pet from the clutches of a villain, the GM can choose to instead make that an owlbear companion, allowing the creature to join their rescuers and become part of subsequent adventures.

Gain Ferocity.name: Gain Ferocity
Gain Ferocity.condition: The companion isn't incapacitated at the start of their and their caregiver's turn

Part of the Pack.name: Part of the Pack
Part of the Pack.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s caregiver is &reference[charmed apply=false], &reference[frightened apply=false], or &reference[stunned apply=false] while within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can end one of those conditions on the caregiver.

Overwhelming Attack.name: Overwhelming Attack
Overwhelming Attack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals an extra [[lookup @prof]] damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Flame On.name: Flame On
Flame On.description: Melee or Ranged Power Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. [[/damage extended]] and any flammable object hit by the flame ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

Imbue Flame.name: Imbue Flame
Imbue Flame.description:
You touch a willing creature and imbue them with a spark of fiery psionic force. For the duration, the creature's weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Imbued Flame.name: Imbued Flame
Imbued Flame.description: For the duration of this power, your weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Kindling.name: Kindling
Kindling.description:
You choose three Medium or smaller creatures or object within range, then psionically weaken the forms of the targets to make them more susceptible to fire. A target creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer the appropriate effect for the duration (a target object automatically suffers the effect):

  • If the target has immunity to fire damage, they have resistance to fire damage instead.

  • If the target has resistance to fire damage, they lose this damage resistance.

  • If the target has no immunity or resistance to fire damage, they have vulnerability to fire damage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.G6de3ZXsmQzdLhbl]{Kindling} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Kindling: Fire Resistance.name: Kindling: Fire Resistance
Kindling: Fire Resistance.description: For the duration of this power, your immunity to fire damage has been reduced to resistance to fire damage instead.

Kindling: Normal Fire Damage.name: Kindling: Normal Fire Damage
Kindling: Normal Fire Damage.description: For the duration of this power, your resistance to fire damage is negated.

Kindling: Fire Vulnerability.name: Kindling: Fire Vulnerability
Kindling: Fire Vulnerability.description: For the duration of this power, you have vulnerability to fire damage.

Scorch.name: Scorch
Scorch.description:
A pulse of fire forming a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Eq7IQdMB33wayZlp]{Scorch} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Fire Form.name: Fire Form
Fire Form.description:
You encase yourself in psionic flame and gain the following benefits for the duration:

  • You have a flying speed of 60 feet.

  • You have immunity to cold and fire damage.

  • Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you touches you for the first time on a turn or hits you with a melee attack, that creature takes 1d6 fire damage.

  • Your power attacks, weapon attacks, and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.JhCVEpk57Ng5MR4q]{Fire Form} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Flame's Master.name: Flame's Master
Flame's Master.description: You emit a burst of psionic energy that affects every Medium or smaller fire-based light source within range, allowing you to ignite a target light source or snuff it out, choosing individually for each source. Such light sources include campfires, candles, fireplaces, lanterns, oil lamps, torches, and the like, but don't include supernatural sources such as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.yiYCqmD5n08NftYk]{Sun Blade} or an object affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi] spell

Illuminator.name: Illuminator
Illuminator.description: You create a focused 30-foot cone of bright light, which has sharp edges and gives off no dim light. You can change the color of the light and can turn it on and off as you desire (no action required).

Illuminator.name: Illuminator
Illuminator.description: A 30-foot cone of bright light originates from you, which has sharp edges and gives off no dim light. You can change the color of the light and turn it on and off as you desire (no action required.)

Extinguish.name: Extinguish
Extinguish.description:
Choose one creature, object, or psionic effect within range. Any power of 3rd order or lower on the target ends.

Heat Shell.name: Heat Shell
Heat Shell.description:
A shimmering globe of heat extends out from you in a 10-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you and lasting for the duration. When you manifest this power, you can choose any number of creatures or objects that you can see within 60 feet of you to be unaffected by it.

Whenever a creature affected by this power touches the heat shell for the first time on a turn or starts their turn inside the globe or within 10 feet of its exterior, they take 4d8 fire damage. The shell prevents an affected creature from moving or reaching into or out of it, but all creatures can cast spells, manifest powers, or make attacks with ranged or reach weapons through the shell.

The heat shell ignites flammable objects it touches that aren't being worn or carried

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.CGV92d4ffdNImcjs]{Heat Shell} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Heat Shell Contact Damage.name: Heat Shell Contact Damage
Heat Shell Contact Damage.condition: Whenever a creature affected by this power touches the heat shell for the first time on a turn or starts their turn inside the globe or within 10 feet of its exterior.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description:
You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.GGNAETkLxGauiNhb]{Penetrating Sight} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Read Object.name: Read Object
Read Object.description:
You touch an object and gain the following information regarding it:

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

  • You see and hear any events that have occurred within 20 feet of the object within the last 8 hours, perceiving those events from the object's perspective.

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.5dYeQREPcdG5YyA7]{Read Object} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Distant Voice.name: Distant Voice
Distant Voice.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or fewer to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if they know you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The power enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Wpc0dTKd3uAI5G82]{Distant Voice} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description:
Choose a creature within range that you can see. For the duration, you learn the surface thoughts of that creature—what is most on their mind in that moment. While reading the target's mind, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) checks made to assess or influence the target.

A creature that has an Intelligence of 3 or lower, or which doesn't speak any language, can't be targeted by this power.

Foundry Note

Restore the Past.name: Restore the Past
Restore the Past.description:
You touch a piece of a Large or smaller mundane object that has been destroyed, then remake that object with your mind. You can remake the object even if some of its broken pieces are missing, or if it has been reduced to dust by a disintegrate spell.

The object can have a value of no more than 1,000 gp. Once an object has been remade, this power can't be used to remake another version of the object even if you have other pieces of the original remaining.

Foundry Note

Signature Attack (Daggers).description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Beginning at 7th level, the schemer can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

This Way.name: This Way
This Way.description: The sound of an orderly march rings out throughout the lair. Each hostile creature that can hear the sound and is within 60 feet of [[lookup @name]] must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or use their reaction to move their speed toward the dragon. An affected creature avoids obviously dangerous ground such as a fire or a pit.

No Power Here.name: No Power Here
No Power Here.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses up to two spellcasting creatures that they can see within 60 feet of them. Each creature must succeed on a DC 20 ability check using their spellcasting ability or be unable to cast any spells except cantrips until the end of their next turn.

No Power Here.name: No Power Here
No Power Here.description: You are unable to cast any spells except cantrips until the end of your next turn.

I Won't Allow It.name: I Won't Allow It
I Won't Allow It.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses one creature, object, or supernatural effect they can see within 120 feet of them. Any powers of 2nd order or lower and any spells of 3rd level or lower on the target end. Additionally, all illusion spells on the target end, regardless of level.

Weight of Reality.name: Weight of Reality
Weight of Reality.description: [[lookup @name]] drops an invisible weight on each hostile creature they can see within 60 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or take [[/damage average]] damage and fall &reference[prone].

Hungry for Magic.name: Hungry for Magic
Hungry for Magic.description: [[lookup @name]] teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space they can see that is within 10 feet of a creature that can cast spells. They then make two [[/item y5YlAgakG3pK4F5g]] attacks with advantage against the creature.

Shield of Vengeance.name: Shield of Vengeance
Shield of Vengeance.description: [[lookup @name]] surrounds themself in a shimmering psionic shield that lasts until the end of their next turn. Whenever a creature deals damage to [[lookup @name]] with an unarmed strike, a weapon attack, or a spell while the shield is active, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Vengeance Damage.name: Vengeance Damage
Vengeance Damage.condition: When a creature hits you with an unarmed strike, a weapon attack, or a spell while the shield is active.

Shield of Vengeance.name: Shield of Vengeance
Shield of Vengeance.description: Whenever a creature deals damage to you with an unarmed strike, a weapon attack, or a spell while the shield is active, that creature takes [[/damage average 6d10 psychic]] damage.

Rewrite.name: Rewrite
Rewrite.description: You bend a small portion of reality to target a Tiny mundane object within range that isn't carried or worn by another creature. For the duration, that object is transformed into another Tiny mundane object of your choice, which must be of the same or lesser value as the original.

Fracture.name: Fracture
Fracture.description:
You unleash a burst of psionic power at a point within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make an Intelligence saving throw. Fractured.name: Fractured
