Penetrating Sight.description: You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Stasis Field.name: Stasis Field
Stasis Field.description:
You shape a translucent 20-foot cube originating from you, within which you control the effects of time to make objects immune from harm. For the duration, objects in the cube when it appears that aren't worn or carried by a creature can't be moved, damaged, or destroyed. If part of an object is inside the cube and part of it is outside, the part that is outside can be damaged.

You and any creatures in the cube when it appears can move through it freely, and can cast spells and manifest powers through the cube. All other creatures, spells, powers, and supernatural effects are barred from passing through the cube.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.uWUiRJ2o7KzcjcNq]{Stasis Field} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Witness Demise.name: Witness Demise
Witness Demise.description:
You project a mental image into the minds of up to three creatures you can see within range. Choose one of the following options, which affects all targets:

Future Demise. You show each target a possible death that they will experience far in the future, which is peaceful or heroic. For the duration, each target can't be &reference[frightened apply=false], and has advantage on saving throws.

Imminent Demise. You show each target a possible death that they will experience imminently, which is violent or terrible. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 8d8 psychic damage and is &reference[frightened] of you for the duration (save ends at end of turn). On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not frightened.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.wJvSjNKTHSdolyS9]{Witness Demise} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Future Demise.name: Future Demise
Future Demise.description: You have been shown a possible death you will experience far in the future, either peaceful or heroic. For the duration of this power, you can't be &reference[frightened apply=false] and have advantage on saving throws.

Imminent Demise.name: Imminent Demise
Imminent Demise.description:
You have been shown your imminent demise, and are &reference[frightened apply=false] for the duration of this power.

At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat your saving throw against this power, ending frightened condition on yourself on a success.

Ally of Time.name: Ally of Time
Ally of Time.description:
You alter time in a 40-foot cube within range for the duration. Whenever a creature starts their turn within the cube, you can choose one of the following effects (no action required):

Accelerate. Until the start of the target's next turn, their speed is doubled, they have a +2 bonus to AC, and they have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. The target gains an additional action that can be used only to take the Attack action (one weapon attack only), the Cast a Spell action (cantrip only), the Manifest a Power action (1st-order power only), or the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object actions.

Decelerate. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer the following effects until the start of their next turn: their speed is halved, they have a -2 penalty to AC, they have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and they can't use reactions. Additionally, the creature can take an action or a bonus action on their current turn, but not both, and can't make more than one attack regardless of features or magic items.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.yAkKzmwxV0XGRHeq]{Ally of Time} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Accelerate.name: Accelerate
Accelerate.condition: Whenever a creature starts their turn within the cube.

affects.special: A creature within the area of the power.

Decelerate.name: Decelerate
Decelerate.condition: Whenever a creature starts their turn within the cube.

affects.special: A creature within the area of the power.

Accelerated.name: Accelerated
Accelerated.description:
Until the start of your next turn, your speed is doubled, you have a +2 bonus to your Armor Class, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

Additionally, you gain an additional action that can be used only to take the Attack action (one weapon attack only), the Cast a Spell action (cantrip only), the Manifest a Power action (1st-order power only), or the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object actions.

Decelerated.name: Decelerated
Decelerated.description:
Until the start of your next turn, your movement speed is halved, you have a -2 penalty to your Armor Class, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and you can't use reactions.

Additionally, you can take an action or bonus action on your turn, but not both, and you can't make more than one attack regardless of features or magic items.

Restore the Past.name: Restore the Past
Restore the Past.description:
You touch a piece of a Large or smaller mundane object that has been destroyed, then remake that object with your mind. You can remake the object even if some of its broken pieces are missing, or if it has been reduced to dust by a disintegrate spell.

The object can have a value of no more than 1,000 gp. Once an object has been remade, this power can't be used to remake another version of the object even if you have other pieces of the original remaining.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.disaBgltbKSxb2Pv]{Restore the Past} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Reveal the Path.name: Reveal the Path
Reveal the Path.description:
When you manifest this power, you describe or name a creature that is familiar to you that has passed within 1,000 feet of your location in the last 24 hours. You instantly know every location the creature visited within the last 24 hours on the plane of existence where you manifested this power. You know the direction and distance to these locations, but not how to access them.

This power can target a specific creature known to you, or a creature you have seen within 30 feet of you at least once or whose detailed image you have seen (such as a professional portrait). If the creature you described or named is in a different form, such as being under the effect of a polymorph spell, this power doesn't locate the creature.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.dCerX4c51qjwd48G]{Reveal the Path} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Read Object.name: Read Object
Read Object.description:
You touch an object and gain the following information regarding it:

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

  • You see and hear any events that have occurred within 20 feet of the object within the last 8 hours, perceiving those events from the object's perspective.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.5dYeQREPcdG5YyA7]{Read Object} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Sacrificial Resistance.name: Sacrificial Resistance
Sacrificial Resistance.description: If [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead. When he uses this trait, his [[/item kJ9MJepu2dtJaNlT]] doesn't function until the start of his next turn.

utility.condition: When Cthrion Uronziir fails a saving throw.

Awe Aura.name: Awe Aura
Awe Aura.description: A psionic aura surrounds [[lookup @name]] in a 30-foot radius sphere. Whenever a hostile creature starts their turn in the aura, they must succeed on a DC 24 Charisma saving throw or be &reference[frightened] of [[lookup @name]] until the start of their next turn. While frightened in this way, the target can't undertake any action intended to harm [[lookup @name]]. On a successful save, a creature is immune to [[lookup @name]]'s Awe Aura, but not his Exploding Aura, for 24 hours.

save.condition: When a creature starts their turn within 30 feet of Graxituron.

Aura Size: 30 Feet.name: Aura Size: 30 Feet
Aura Size: 30 Feet.description: The base size of Graxituron's Awe Aura is 30 feet.

Distant Voice.name: Distant Voice
Distant Voice.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or fewer to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if they know you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The power enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Wpc0dTKd3uAI5G82]{Distant Voice} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Rewrite.name: Rewrite
Rewrite.description: You bend a small portion of reality to target a Tiny mundane object within range that isn't carried or worn by another creature. For the duration, that object is transformed into another Tiny mundane object of your choice, which must be of the same or lesser value as the original.

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description:
Choose a creature within range that you can see. For the duration, you learn the surface thoughts of that creature—what is most on their mind in that moment. While reading the target's mind, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) checks made to assess or influence the target.

A creature that has an Intelligence of 3 or lower, or which doesn't speak any language, can't be targeted by this power.

Increased Order. When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1. When you do so, you can use a bonus action while the power is active to dig deeper into the target's mind, forcing them to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the power ends. On a failure, you gain insight into the target's reasoning (if any), their emotional state, and one thing that looms large in their mind (a problem they are worried over, a person they love or hate, and so forth). Whether the saving throw succeeds or fails, the target doesn't know that you attempted to dig into their mind.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.upjlD8RPGVou46Mm]{Read Thoughts} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Broadcast.name: Broadcast
Broadcast.description:
You broadcast a telepathic message to every creature of your choice that can understand a language, and which is within a specific distance you choose within range. The message lasts for 1 minute, and can include images of events that you have personally witnessed. A creature that receives the message hears your words and sees the images in their mind, though they still maintain their own senses.

You can further refine the parameters for recipients based on creature kind (for example, the message could be sent only to Humanoids, or gnolls could be excluded from receiving the message) or creatures of a particular alignment (for example, the message could be sent only to good-aligned creatures, or lawful-aligned creatures could be excluded from receiving the message).

A creature that is on another plane of existence does not receive the message.

Increased Order. When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 to increase the range to 5 miles.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.7knK35LTZFodOIYY]{Broadcast} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Fold Space.name: Fold Space
Fold Space.description:
You bend space to create a one-way pathway to a destination you select, which lasts until the end of your next turn. The opening of the pathway is a 10-foot diameter circle that appears in an unoccupied space within range. Any creature that passes through the opening is transported to the destination.

The destination you choose can be on any plane of existence. It must be known to you, though you don't need to have visited it. The power fails if you select a destination that doesn't exist, such as a place you think you know that was actually an illusion, or a familiar location that has been destroyed.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.XBOelYSnCIWS8rq1]{Fold Space} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Restore the Past.name: Restore the Past
Restore the Past.description:
You touch a piece of a Large or smaller mundane object that has been destroyed, then remake that object with your mind. You can remake the object even if some of its broken pieces are missing, or if it has been reduced to dust by a disintegrate spell.

The object can have a value of no more than 1,000 gp. Once an object has been remade, this power can't be used to remake another version of the object even if you have other pieces of the original remaining.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.disaBgltbKSxb2Pv]{Restore the Past} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Stasis Field.name: Stasis Field
Stasis Field.description:
You shape a translucent 20-foot cube originating from you, within which you control the effects of time to make objects immune from harm. For the duration, objects in the cube when it appears that aren't worn or carried by a creature can't be moved, damaged, or destroyed. If part of an object is inside the cube and part of it is outside, the part that is outside can be damaged.

You and any creatures in the cube when it appears can move through it freely, and can cast spells and manifest powers through the cube. All other creatures, spells, powers, and supernatural effects are barred from passing through the cube.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.uWUiRJ2o7KzcjcNq]{Stasis Field} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Reveal the Path.name: Reveal the Path
Reveal the Path.description:
When you manifest this power, you describe or name a creature that is familiar to you that has passed within 1,000 feet of your location in the last 24 hours. You instantly know every location the creature visited within the last 24 hours on the plane of existence where you manifested this power. You know the direction and distance to these locations, but not how to access them.

This power can target a specific creature known to you, or a creature you have seen within 30 feet of you at least once or whose detailed image you have seen (such as a professional portrait). If the creature you described or named is in a different form, such as being under the effect of a polymorph spell, this power doesn't locate the creature.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.dCerX4c51qjwd48G]{Reveal the Path} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Read Object.name: Read Object
Read Object.description:
You touch an object and gain the following information regarding it:

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

  • You see and hear any events that have occurred within 20 feet of the object within the last 8 hours, perceiving those events from the object's perspective.

Increased Order. When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1. When you do so, you can place an invisible psionic sensor on the object that lasts for 24 hours. For the duration, you can use an action to learn the object's distance and direction relative to you, and to see and hear the object's surroundings from its point of view as if you were there.

Memory Gap.name: Memory Gap
Memory Gap.description:
By manipulating time, you attempt to erase another creature's memories. One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. On a failure, you can erase the target's memory of an event that they experienced within the last 24 hours and that lasted no more than 10 minutes, permanently eliminating all memory of the event. You do not need to have witnessed the event, but must be aware of the event and its details in some way, even as a second-hand account. Once the memory is erased, the target can't recall what happened to them during that time, but they are unbothered by the hole in their recollection.

Any creature that can sense psionics, such as one under the influence of the sixth sense power, can tell the target has had their memory modified. The cure ailment power manifested on the target restores the creature's memory.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.VkJqUgtd2n5bz5PU]{Memory Gap} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Telekinetic Burst.name: Telekinetic Burst
Telekinetic Burst.description:
You unleash an explosion of mental force from a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 11d6 force damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the center of the area. On a success, a target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.GRRKLKZMvSO8SOXJ]{Telekinetic Burst} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Mass Choke.name: Mass Choke
Mass Choke.description:
You attempt to lock your enemies in your telekinetic grip. Each creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become &reference[restrained] for the duration (save ends at end of turn). A creature restrained in this way takes 5d8 force damage at the start of each of their turns. The power ends if the target is ever outside the power's range or if they have total cover from you.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.l8JXZIAQioBwbQ4P]{Mass Choke} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Mass Choke.name: Mass Choke
Mass Choke.description:
You are &reference[restrained apply=false] for the duration of this power. While choked in this way, you take [[/damage 5d8 force]] damage at the start of each of your turns.

You can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on yourself on a success.

Growing Aura.name: Growing Aura
Growing Aura.description:
If the radius of [[lookup @name]]'s [[/item 1okPRFTesIkYpJrG]] is less than 60 feet, it increases 15 feet to a maximum of 60 feet.

Current Aura Radius: [[lookup @flags.world.aweaura]] Feet

Foundry Note

You can apply the "Growing Aura" Active Effect from this feature to [[lookup @name]] in order to increase the size of the aura by 15 feet for each instance of the effect on them.

Growing Aura.name: Growing Aura
Growing Aura.description: The radius of the dragon's aura increases by 15 feet.

Exploding Aura.name: Exploding Aura
Exploding Aura.description:
If the radius of [[lookup @name]]'s [[/item 1okPRFTesIkYpJrG]] is 60 feet, the aura explodes in a burst of temporal energy. Each creature of [[lookup @name]]'s choice within 60 feet of him must make a [[/save]] saving throw, taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The radius of [[lookup @name]]'s Awe Aura then shrinks to 30 feet.

Current Aura Radius: [[lookup @flags.world.aweaura]] Feet

Foundry Note

Remove all instances of the "Growing Aura" Active Effect when you use this feature in order to reduce the size of [[lookup @name]]'s Aura.

Return to Weakness.name: Return to Weakness
Return to Weakness.description: [[lookup @name]] unleashes a wave of temporal distortion, attempting to return enemies to a time when they were in a vulnerable state. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of him must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or wither for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). At the start of each of their turns, an affected creature has their hit point maximum reduced by 11 (2d10). If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 this way, they die and crumble to dust. The @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.TPP69IqlT5U7MTm0]{Cure Ailment} power, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell, or a similar supernatural effect ends the withering effect if still ongoing, and restores an affected creature's hit point maximum to normal.

Return to Weakness.name: Return to Weakness
Return to Weakness.description:
At the start of each of your turns, your maximum hit points are reduced by 11 ([[/r 2d10]]). If your hit point maximum is reduced to 0 this way, you die and crumble to dust. The @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.TPP69IqlT5U7MTm0]{Cure Ailment} power, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell, or a similar supernatural effect ends the withering effect if still ongoing, and restores your hit point maximum to normal.

At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat your saving throw against this feature, ending this effect on yourself on a success.

Midnight Hour.name: Midnight Hour
Midnight Hour.description: Psionic darkness pours from [[lookup @name]]'s body in a 30-foot-radius aura that lasts until the end of his next turn. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and light can't illuminate it. When a creature other than [[lookup @name]] ends their turn in the darkness, [[lookup @name]] can move that creature up to 15 feet horizontally.

A Different You.name: A Different You
A Different You.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses another creature he can see within 120 feet of him and calls forth a duplicate version of that creature from another timeline to serve him. The duplicate appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of [[lookup @name]], and uses the same statistics as the original creature as if that creature had just finished a long rest. The duplicate immediately takes one turn, acting as directed by [[lookup @name]]. At the end of the duplicate's turn, it dies in a psionic explosion, and the original creature must make a [[/save]] saving throw, taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Temporal Dissonance.name: Temporal Dissonance
Temporal Dissonance.description: [[lookup @name]] vibrates at super speed, appearing blurry and distorted . Until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round, any creature with a passive Wisdom (Perception) score of 17 or lower has disadvantage on attack rolls against [[lookup @name]].

Temporal Dissonance.name: Temporal Dissonance
Temporal Dissonance.description: Until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round, any creature with a passive Wisdom (Perception) score of 17 or lower has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Time Freeze.name: Time Freeze
Time Freeze.description: Time twists around three creatures that [[lookup @name]] can see within 120 feet of him. Each target must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or have their speed reduced to 0 and be unable to regain hit points until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

Time Freeze.name: Time Freeze
Time Freeze.description: Until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round, your speed is reduced to 0 and you are unable to regain hit points.

Violent Isolation.name: Violent Isolation
Violent Isolation.description: [[lookup @name]] teleports 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. After he teleports, he can choose one creature within 120 feet of him, forcing that creature to succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or be teleported to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of Graxituron.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] uses [[/item vwtZq3DJWT28tR12]]. He then makes one [[/item kmdnHkc52cdDq90w]] attack and two [[/item 7EPch7PKsmWlVnGi]] attacks, or he uses [[/item GrGTdHMmon7pG6bN]] or [[/item dmtdM0ej6ya2uRMa]], if available.

Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

  1. [[/item vq4GDDyQMsjC1j94]]
  2. [[/item LpPqk3sToIrwoBDz]]
  3. [[/item 2uqpjMA1MFM7ccbW]]

Mind Surgeon.name: Mind Surgeon
Mind Surgeon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] touches one creature (which can be themself), causing that creature to regain 11 (2d10) hit points, to be cured of all diseases, or to be neutralized of all poisons affecting them (the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice).

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Beam Gaze.name: Beam Gaze
Beam Gaze.description:
You unleash a sickening beam of force at a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d10 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a target also suffers your choice of one of the following effects for the duration (save ends at end of turn):

  • The target is &reference[poisoned].

  • The target's speed is halved, and they can't take reactions.

  • Attack rolls against the target are made with advantage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.szBj3TYynI8mh8YH]{Beam Gaze} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Beam Gaze: Poisoned.name: Beam Gaze: Poisoned
Beam Gaze: Poisoned.description: You are &reference[poisoned apply=false] for the next minute. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Beam Gaze: Slowed.name: Beam Gaze: Slowed
Beam Gaze: Slowed.description: Your movement speed is halved, and you can't take reactions. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Beam Gaze: Marked.name: Beam Gaze: Marked
Beam Gaze: Marked.description: All attack rolls made against you are made at advantage. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Amplify.name: Amplify
Amplify.description:
You channel psionic power into the battle fury of a creature you can see within range. The next time the target hits a creature with a weapon attack during the power's duration, the attack deals an extra 2d8 psychic damage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.ef1YKi000yMXtAuL]{Amplify} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Amplify (3rd Order).name: Amplify (3rd Order)
Amplify (3rd Order).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this power's duration, the attack deals an extra 2d8 psychic damage.

Amplify (4th Order).name: Amplify (4th Order)
Amplify (4th Order).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this power's duration, the attack deals an extra 3d8 psychic damage.

Amplify (5th Order).name: Amplify (5th Order)
Amplify (5th Order).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this power's duration, the attack deals an extra 4d8 psychic damage.

Amplify (6th Order).name: Amplify (6th Order)
Amplify (6th Order).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this power's duration, the attack deals an extra 5d8 psychic damage.

Cure Ailment.name: Cure Ailment
Cure Ailment.description:
You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition affecting them. The condition can be &reference[blinded apply=false], &reference[charmed apply=false], dazed, &reference[deafened apply=false], &reference[frightened apply=false], or &reference[poisoned apply=false].

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.TPP69IqlT5U7MTm0]{Cure Ailment} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Embrace the Deep.name: Embrace the Deep
Embrace the Deep.description:
You choose up to five willing creatures you can see within range, then psionically imbue those creatures with the power to move beneath earth or water. For the duration, each creature doesn't need to breathe and gains one of the following adaptations of your choice, which must be applied to all targets:

Earth Mastery. The target has a burrowing speed equal to their walking speed.

Water Mastery. The target has a swimming speed equal to their walking speed.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.xtk0qV0Iqxgn0alo]{Embrace the Deep} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Embrace the Deep: Earth Mastery.name: Embrace the Deep: Earth Mastery
Embrace the Deep: Earth Mastery.description: For the duration of this power, you don't need to breathe and you have a burrowing speed equal to your walking speed.

Embrace the Deep: Water Mastery.name: Embrace the Deep: Water Mastery
Embrace the Deep: Water Mastery.description: For the duration of this power, you don't need to breathe and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description:
You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.GGNAETkLxGauiNhb]{Penetrating Sight} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description: You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Sixth Sense.name: Sixth Sense
Sixth Sense.description:
You touch a willing creature and give them one of the following senses for the duration:

  • The target gains darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

  • The target gains tremorsense out to a range of 10 feet.

  • The target can sense the presence of psionics within 30 feet of them. If the target senses psionics in this way, they can use an action to see a faint aura around each visible creature or object within 30 feet of them that bears psionic power. This sense can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.WyqGnnjUD95F0bjx]{Sixth Sense} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Sixth Sense: Darkvision.name: Sixth Sense: Darkvision
Sixth Sense: Darkvision.description: For the duration of this power, you gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

Sixth Sense: Tremorsense.name: Sixth Sense: Tremorsense
Sixth Sense: Tremorsense.description: For the duration of this power, you gain tremorsense out to a range of 10 feet.

Sixth Sense: Psionic Detection.name: Sixth Sense: Psionic Detection
Sixth Sense: Psionic Detection.description: For the duration of this power, you can sense the presence of psionics within 30 feet of you. If you sense psionics in this way, they can use an action to see a faint aura around each visible creature or object within 30 feet of them that bears psionic power. This sense can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Sharpened Senses.name: Sharpened Senses
Sharpened Senses.description: You make a Wisdom (Perception) check to detect hidden creatures, doors, objects, or traps in your immediate surroundings, focusing your senses psionically to grant you advantage on the check.

Minor Acceleration.name: Minor Acceleration
Minor Acceleration.description: You touch a willing creature to cause their speed to increase by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

Minor Acceleration.name: Minor Acceleration
Minor Acceleration.description: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the manifester's next turn.

Psionic Bolt.name: Psionic Bolt
Psionic Bolt.description:
You shoot forth a purple beam of psychic force to strike a creature or object in range. Make a ranged power attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 force damage, and if they are Large or smaller, they are pushed 5 feet away from you.

This attack's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Standing Leap.name: Standing Leap
Standing Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s long jump is up to 20 feet and their high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

Monstrous Companion.name: Monstrous Companion
Monstrous Companion.description: Companion creatures are designed to accompany player characters on adventures. If an NPC has a pet or creature servant, it is recommended that you use the creature's normal stat block. For instance, if an NPC ranger has an owlbear that they work with, that creature would use the normal Owlbear stat block and be played by the GM as normal. But if the characters are charged with rescuing a fallen druid NPC's owlbear pet from the clutches of a villain, the GM can choose to instead make that an owlbear companion, allowing the creature to join their rescuers and become part of subsequent adventures.

Gain Ferocity.name: Gain Ferocity
Gain Ferocity.condition: The companion isn't incapacitated at the start of their and their caregiver's turn

Stretch Attack.name: Stretch Attack
Stretch Attack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a signature attack with a reach of 10 feet using their tongue. On a hit, the attack deals an extra [[lookup @prof]] damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] pull the target 5 feet toward them.

Psychedelic Skin.name: Psychedelic Skin
Psychedelic Skin.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s caregiver is within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use a bonus action to coat a melee weapon held by the caregiver with poison secreted from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s skin. The poison lasts for 1 hour or until the weapon deals damage as part of an attack. When a creature takes damage from the weapon, they must succeed on a DC 10 + PB Constitution saving throw or become &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themself on a success.

Monstrous Companion.name: Monstrous Companion
Monstrous Companion.description: Companion creatures are designed to accompany player characters on adventures. If an NPC has a pet or creature servant, it is recommended that you use the creature's normal stat block. For instance, if an NPC ranger has an owlbear that they work with, that creature would use the normal Owlbear stat block and be played by the GM as normal. But if the characters are charged with rescuing a fallen druid NPC's owlbear pet from the clutches of a villain, the GM can choose to instead make that an owlbear companion, allowing the creature to join their rescuers and become part of subsequent adventures.

Gain Ferocity.name: Gain Ferocity
Gain Ferocity.condition: The companion isn't incapacitated at the start of their and their caregiver's turn

Overwhelming Attack.name: Overwhelming Attack
Overwhelming Attack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals an extra [[lookup @prof]] damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Manipulate Terrain.name: Manipulate Terrain
Manipulate Terrain.description: The ground within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is &reference[difficultterrain] for their enemies. At the start of each of the resopath's turns, they can choose up to three creatures they can see in that area, each of which takes 10 percing damage.

Psionic Bolt.name: Psionic Bolt
Psionic Bolt.description:
You shoot forth a purple beam of psychic force to strike a creature or object in range. Make a ranged power attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 force damage, and if they are Large or smaller, they are pushed 5 feet away from you.

This attack's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

Elsewhere.name: Elsewhere
Elsewhere.description:
You target four creatures you can see within range, then attempt to violently teleport them away. Each creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target is teleported up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, and their speed becomes 0 until the start of your next turn.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.ThLFuuGFgCEhvlMP]{Elsewhere} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Jaunt.name: Jaunt
Jaunt.description:
You bend the space of your environment for an instant, allowing you or one willing creature you touch to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. If you target another creature, they do not need to be able to see the destination.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.0U3lWvv8enI1Bmll]{Jaunt} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Momentary Lapse of Reason.name: Momentary Lapse of Reason
Momentary Lapse of Reason.description:
Choose one creature or object you can see within range. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of the target sees the target as something they greatly desire, and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature drops whatever they are holding and uses their reaction, if available, to move their speed toward the target by the most direct route. If the creature gets within 5 feet of the target, they stop moving and fall &reference[prone].

Creatures that can't be &reference[charmed apply=false] are immune to this power.

Foundry Note

Fold Space.name: Fold Space
Fold Space.description:
You bend space to create a one-way pathway to a destination you select, which lasts until the end of your next turn. The opening of the pathway is a 10-foot diameter circle that appears in an unoccupied space within range. Any creature that passes through the opening is transported to the destination.

The destination you choose can be on any plane of existence. It must be known to you, though you don't need to have visited it. The power fails if you select a destination that doesn't exist, such as a place you think you know that was actually an illusion, or a familiar location that has been destroyed.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.XBOelYSnCIWS8rq1]{Fold Space} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Reminisce.name: Reminisce
Reminisce.description:
With this power, you attempt to manipulate a creature using their memories and emotions. One creature within range that you can see must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. On a failed save, the target believes that a friend or loved one has approached them and wishes to have a pleasant conversation. The target stops whatever they are doing, taking no actions while they engage in a conversation with the imaginary acquaintance for the duration.

The target can repeat the saving throw if they take damage, or if another creature uses an action to point out that the target isn't having a conversation with a real person, ending the effect on themself on a success. A creature that can't be &reference[charmed apply=false] is immune to this power.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.cBxGKyT55vuUKISF]{Reminisce} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Reminiscing.name: Reminiscing
Reminiscing.description:
For the duration of this effect, you believe that a friend or loved one has approached you and wishes to have a pleasant conversation. You stop whatever you are doing, taking no actions while you engage in a conversation with the acquaintance.

If you take damage or another creature uses an action to point out that the acquaintance you are having a conversation with is not a real person, you may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description:
Choose a creature within range that you can see. For the duration, you learn the surface thoughts of that creature—what is most on their mind in that moment. While reading the target's mind, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) checks made to assess or influence the target.

A creature that has an Intelligence of 3 or lower, or which doesn't speak any language, can't be targeted by this power.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.upjlD8RPGVou46Mm]{Read Thoughts} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Adapt.name: Adapt
Adapt.description:
Choose up to four willing creatures you can see within range. For the duration, each target can survive without any food or water, and is immune to exhaustion caused by mundane environmental or weather effects.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.OSbTviaBTOEA7qR5]{Adapt} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Adapted.name: Adapted
Adapted.description: For the duration of this power, you can survive without any food or water, and you are immune to exhaustion caused by mundane environmental or weather effects.

Restructure.name: Restructure
Restructure.description:
You touch a Large or smaller mundane object to set up psionic vibrations within it, altering the material it is made out of (from metal to stone, from wood to glass, and so forth). You can't change the object's state—gas, liquid, or solid—and you can't increase its value. For example, if you turn a silver statue into a gold statue, the gold is of such poor quality that the statue's worth remains the same.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.jHG9QmBtcRB2uvFV]{Restructure} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

affects.special: A large or smaller mundane object.

Guise.name: Guise
Guise.description:
You project a psionic appearance over your own body, transforming yourself into any creature you have encountered that is your size, though none of your statistics change. You can also change the appearance of any gear you wear or hold when you manifest this power.

Your changed appearance fails to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this power to become a mastiff, any object passing directly over the image of the mastiff will bump into you while seemingly in midair, and anyone who pets the mastiff would feel your body.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use an action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your talent power save DC.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.FQvVmMjtBidvc3L1]{Guise} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Psionic Guise.name: Psionic Guise
Psionic Guise.description:
You have projected a psionic appearance over your own body, transforming yourself into any creature you have encountered that is your size, though none of your statistics change. You can also change the appearance of any gear you wear or hold when you manifest this power.

Psionic Guise: Grow.name: Psionic Guise: Grow
Psionic Guise: Grow.description: Your size category increases by one size, your size doubles in all dimensions, and your weight is multiplied by eight. If there isn't enough room for you to grow appropriately, you attain the maximum possible size in the space available. You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Any weapons that grow with you deal an extra 1d4 damage per size category they grow.

Psionic Guise: Shrink.name: Psionic Guise: Shrink
Psionic Guise: Shrink.description: You become one size category smaller. For each size category smaller you become, your size is halved in all dimensions and your weight is divided by 8. You have disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Any weapons that shrink with you reduce their damage by 1d4 per size category they shrink (to a minimum 1 damage).

Extinguish.name: Extinguish
Extinguish.description:
Choose one creature, object, or psionic effect within range. Any power of 3rd order or lower on the target ends.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.bUKtjbjz8MGaEI8Q]{Extinguish} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Apparition.name: Apparition
Apparition.description: You create a sound or an image that only you and one creature within range perceive. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a creature's roar, a musical instrument, or any other sound you choose. If you create an image, it must fit within a 5-foot cube and can't move. The image can't create any effect that influences a sense other than sight. The image disappears if the perceiving creature touches it.

Rewrite.name: Rewrite
Rewrite.description: You bend a small portion of reality to target a Tiny mundane object within range that isn't carried or worn by another creature. For the duration, that object is transformed into another Tiny mundane object of your choice, which must be of the same or lesser value as the original.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through mundane, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn't disturb the material they move through. While they use Earth Glide, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't be used as a mount.

Monstrous Companion.name: Monstrous Companion
Monstrous Companion.description: Companion creatures are designed to accompany player characters on adventures. If an NPC has a pet or creature servant, it is recommended that you use the creature's normal stat block. For instance, if an NPC ranger has an owlbear that they work with, that creature would use the normal @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.zY3W5MG7FjssENf6] stat block and be played by the GM as normal. But if the characters are charged with rescuing a fallen druid NPC's owlbear pet from the clutches of a villain, the GM can choose to instead make that an @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.actors.Actor.f4L7LTQ5HMS7FFoL], allowing the creature to join their rescuers and become part of subsequent adventures.

Gain Ferocity.name: Gain Ferocity
Gain Ferocity.condition: The companion isn't incapacitated at the start of their and their caregiver's turn

Toss Me.name: Toss Me
Toss Me.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is within 5 feet of their caregiver, they can hurl the caregiver [[5 * @prof.flat]] feet in any direction, including up. If the caregiver would normally take damage from &Reference[falling]{a fall} after being thrown, they can negate the damage with a successful DC 15 Dexterity saving throw.

Stretch Attack.name: Stretch Attack
Stretch Attack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a signature attack with a reach of 10 feet. On a hit, the attack deals an extra [[lookup @prof]] damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can pull the target 5 feet toward them.

Amethyst Dust.name: Amethyst Dust
Amethyst Dust.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses up to three creatures she can see within 90 feet of her. Each target must make a [[/save]] saving throw as psionic amethyst dust appears, shimmering around their body. On a failed save, a target is &reference[restrained] by the dust until it disappears at the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

Amethyst Dust.name: Amethyst Dust
Amethyst Dust.description: You are &reference[restrained apply=false] by psionic amethyst dust until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

Force of Nature.name: Force of Nature
Force of Nature.description: Psionic wind rushes through the lair. Each creature of [[lookup @name]]'s choice within 60 feet of her must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet horizontally in a direction of [[lookup @name]]'s choice, then knocked &reference[prone]. [[lookup @name]] can also move herself up to 30 feet horizontally, and doesn't provoke opportunity attacks for that movement.

Terror Roar.name: Terror Roar
Terror Roar.description: [[lookup @name]] bellows a psionic roar, forcing each creature within 60 feet of her who can hear her to succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or be &reference[frightened] of [[lookup @name]] (save ends at end of turn). If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for them, that creature is immune to this lair action for the next 24 hours.

Terror Roar.name: Terror Roar
Terror Roar.description:
You are &reference[frightened apply=false] of Viomencia. You may repeat your saving throw against Terror Roar at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

If your saving throw against this effect is successful, you are immune to the effects of Terror Roar for the next 24 hours.

I've Seen This.name: I've Seen This
I've Seen This.description: [[lookup @name]] plunders the mind of each hostile creature within 60 feet of her to learn their tactics. Each target has disadvantage on the next attack roll they make against [[lookup @name]], and she has advantage on saving throws made to resist powers, spells, and effects created by each target before the end of that target's next turn

I've Seen This.name: I've Seen This
I've Seen This.description: You have disadvantage on the next attack roll you make against Viomencia. Additionally, she has advantage on saving throws made to resist powers, spells, and effects created by you until the end of your next turn.

Amethyst Charm.name: Amethyst Charm
Amethyst Charm.description: [[lookup @name]] unleashes a pulse of telepathic power. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of her must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or be &reference[charmed] by her. Each target charmed in this way must immediately move up to their speed in a direction of [[lookup @name]]'s choice, then make a weapon attack or cast a damage-dealing cantrip at a target of her choice. [[lookup @name]] can then move up to her speed, and the charmed condition on each target ends.

Utter Devastation.name: Utter Devastation
Utter Devastation.description: [[lookup @name]] enters the mind of each hostile creature she can see within 60 feet of her and offers them a bargain: pain or risk? Each target must choose between losing half their remaining hit points or having disadvantage on saving throws against [[lookup @name]]'s powers and her Exploding Aura for 10 minutes.

Utter Devastation.name: Utter Devastation
Utter Devastation.description: For the next 10 minutes, you have disadvantage on saving throws against Viomencia's powers.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] uses [[/item qaBnSGdwRYLWmtNc]], then makes one [[/item yUHWNwCwOs0BYM0V]] attack and two [[/item nHwX8vSDq2gX08Ns]] attacks, or she uses [[/item GzAXvfOH4n5PpCEK]] if available.

Growing Aura.name: Growing Aura
Growing Aura.description:
If the radius of [[lookup @name]]'s [[/item 1okPRFTesIkYpJrG]] is less than 60 feet, it increases 15 feet to a maximum of 60 feet.

Current Aura Radius: [[lookup @flags.world.feedbackaura]] Feet

Foundry Note

You can apply the "Growing Aura" Active Effect from this feature to [[lookup @name]] in order to increase the size of the aura by 15 feet for each instance of the effect on them.

Growing Aura.name: Growing Aura
Growing Aura.description: The radius of the dragon's aura increases by 15 feet.

Exploding Aura.name: Exploding Aura
Exploding Aura.description:
If the radius of [[lookup @name]]'s Feedback Aura is 60 feet, the aura explodes in a burst of harsh light. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of [[lookup @name]] must make a [[/save]] saving throw, taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The radius of Viomencia's Feedback Aura then shrinks to 30 feet.

Current Aura Radius: [[lookup @flags.world.feedbackaura]] Feet

Foundry Note

Remove all instances of the "Growing Aura" Active Effect when you use this feature in order to reduce the size of [[lookup @name]]'s Aura.

Feedback Aura.name: Feedback Aura
Feedback Aura.description: A psionic aura surrounds [[lookup @name]] in a 30-foot-radius sphere. When [[lookup @name]] takes damage, the aura crackles and each hostile creature in the aura takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Aura Size: 30 Feet.name: Aura Size: 30 Feet
Aura Size: 30 Feet.description: The base size of Viomencia's Feedback Aura is 30 feet.

Sacrificial Resistance.name: Sacrificial Resistance
Sacrificial Resistance.description: If [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. When she uses this trait, her [[/item th383axR30hx6gPW]] doesn't function until the start of her next turn.

utility.condition: When Cthrion Uronziir fails a saving throw.

Beam Gaze.name: Beam Gaze
Beam Gaze.description:
You unleash a sickening beam of force at a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d10 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a target also suffers your choice of one of the following effects for the duration (save ends at end of turn):

  • The target is &reference[poisoned].

  • The target's speed is halved, and they can't take reactions.

  • Attack rolls against the target are made with advantage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.szBj3TYynI8mh8YH]{Beam Gaze} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Beam Gaze: Poisoned.name: Beam Gaze: Poisoned
Beam Gaze: Poisoned.description: You are &reference[poisoned apply=false] for the next minute. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Beam Gaze: Slowed.name: Beam Gaze: Slowed
Beam Gaze: Slowed.description: Your movement speed is halved, and you can't take reactions. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Beam Gaze: Marked.name: Beam Gaze: Marked
Beam Gaze: Marked.description: All attack rolls made against you are made at advantage. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Jaunt.name: Jaunt
Jaunt.description:
You bend the space of your environment for an instant, allowing you or one willing creature you touch to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. If you target another creature, they do not need to be able to see the destination.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.0U3lWvv8enI1Bmll]{Jaunt} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Fortify.name: Fortify
Fortify.description:
You create an invisible barrier that protects the creature taking the triggering damage. The target has resistance to damage of the same type, including against the triggering damage, until the end of your next turn.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.L2bWbaSu8c037AR1]{Fortify} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

activation.condition: When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder damage.

Broadcast.name: Broadcast
Broadcast.description:
You broadcast a telepathic message to every creature of your choice that can understand a language, and which is within a specific distance you choose within range. The message lasts for 1 minute, and can include images of events that you have personally witnessed. A creature that receives the message hears your words and sees the images in their mind, though they still maintain their own senses.

You can further refine the parameters for recipients based on creature kind (for example, the message could be sent only to Humanoids, or gnolls could be excluded from receiving the message) or creatures of a particular alignment (for example, the message could be sent only to good-aligned creatures, or lawful-aligned creatures could be excluded from receiving the message).

A creature that is on another plane of existence does not receive the message.

Increased Order. When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 to increase the range to 5 miles.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.7knK35LTZFodOIYY]{Broadcast} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description:
You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.GGNAETkLxGauiNhb]{Penetrating Sight} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Distant Voice.name: Distant Voice
Distant Voice.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or fewer to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if they know you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The power enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

Foundry Note

Read Object.description:
You touch an object and gain the following information regarding it:

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

  • You see and hear any events that have occurred within 20 feet of the object within the last 8 hours, perceiving those events from the object's perspective.
