Villain Actions.name: Villain Actions
Villain Actions.description:
[[lookup @name]] has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

  1. [[/item oEkPTQJgfj4VcrOV]]
  2. [[/item 0WmLB6aH7cfKHcC7]]
  3. [[/item 84IDdlltjvLGrV7Q]]

Flame On.name: Flame On
Flame On.description: Melee or Ranged Power Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. [[/damage extended]] and any flammable object hit by the flame ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

Imbue Flame.name: Imbue Flame
Imbue Flame.description:
You touch a willing creature and imbue them with a spark of fiery psionic force. For the duration, the creature's weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.y5IFETLo6sTf3mlC]{Imbue Flame} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Imbued Flame.name: Imbued Flame
Imbued Flame.description: For the duration of this power, your weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Kindling.name: Kindling
Kindling.description:
You choose two Medium or smaller creatures or object within range, then psionically weaken the forms of the targets to make them more susceptible to fire. A target creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer the appropriate effect for the duration (a target object automatically suffers the effect):

  • If the target has immunity to fire damage, they have resistance to fire damage instead.

  • If the target has resistance to fire damage, they lose this damage resistance.

  • If the target has no immunity or resistance to fire damage, they have vulnerability to fire damage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.G6de3ZXsmQzdLhbl]{Kindling} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Kindling: Fire Resistance.name: Kindling: Fire Resistance
Kindling: Fire Resistance.description: For the duration of this power, your immunity to fire damage has been reduced to resistance to fire damage instead.

Kindling: Normal Fire Damage.name: Kindling: Normal Fire Damage
Kindling: Normal Fire Damage.description: For the duration of this power, your resistance to fire damage is negated.

Kindling: Fire Vulnerability.name: Kindling: Fire Vulnerability
Kindling: Fire Vulnerability.description: For the duration of this power, you have vulnerability to fire damage.

Scorch.name: Scorch
Scorch.description:
A pulse of fire forming a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Eq7IQdMB33wayZlp]{Scorch} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Flame's Master.name: Flame's Master
Flame's Master.description: You emit a burst of psionic energy that affects every Medium or smaller fire-based light source within range, allowing you to ignite a target light source or snuff it out, choosing individually for each source. Such light sources include campfires, candles, fireplaces, lanterns, oil lamps, torches, and the like, but don't include supernatural sources such as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.yiYCqmD5n08NftYk]{Sun Blade} or an object affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Bnn9Nzajixvow9xi] spell

Illuminator.name: Illuminator
Illuminator.description: You create a focused 30-foot cone of bright light, which has sharp edges and gives off no dim light. You can change the color of the light and can turn it on and off as you desire (no action required).

Illuminator.name: Illuminator
Illuminator.description: A 30-foot cone of bright light originates from you, which has sharp edges and gives off no dim light. You can change the color of the light and turn it on and off as you desire (no action required.)

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description:
You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.GGNAETkLxGauiNhb]{Penetrating Sight} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description: You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Read Object.name: Read Object
Read Object.description:
You touch an object and gain the following information regarding it:

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

  • You see and hear any events that have occurred within 20 feet of the object within the last 8 hours, perceiving those events from the object's perspective.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.5dYeQREPcdG5YyA7]{Read Object} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Distant Voice.name: Distant Voice
Distant Voice.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or fewer to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if they know you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The power enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Wpc0dTKd3uAI5G82]{Distant Voice} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description:
Choose a creature within range that you can see. For the duration, you learn the surface thoughts of that creature—what is most on their mind in that moment. While reading the target's mind, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) checks made to assess or influence the target.

A creature that has an Intelligence of 3 or lower, or which doesn't speak any language, can't be targeted by this power.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.upjlD8RPGVou46Mm]{Read Thoughts} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Keen Sight.name: Keen Sight
Keen Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Monstrous Companion.name: Monstrous Companion
Monstrous Companion.description: Companion creatures are designed to accompany player characters on adventures. If an NPC has a pet or creature servant, it is recommended that you use the creature's normal stat block. For instance, if an NPC ranger has an owlbear that they work with, that creature would use the normal @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.zY3W5MG7FjssENf6] stat block and be played by the GM as normal. But if the characters are charged with rescuing a fallen druid NPC's owlbear pet from the clutches of a villain, the GM can choose to instead make that an @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.actors.Actor.f4L7LTQ5HMS7FFoL], allowing the creature to join their rescuers and become part of subsequent adventures.

Gain Ferocity.name: Gain Ferocity
Gain Ferocity.condition: The companion isn't incapacitated at the start of their and their caregiver's turn

Swoop In.name: Swoop In
Swoop In.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s caregiver is hit with an attack while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is within 30 feet of them, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ends this movement within 5 feet of the caregiver, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] becomes the target of the triggering attack instead, and the attack deals half as much damage.

utility.condition: When the caregiver is hit with an attack.

Distracting Attack.name: Distracting Attack
Distracting Attack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a signature attack. On a hit, the next attack made against the target before the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn has advantage.

Distracting Attack.name: Distracting Attack
Distracting Attack.description: The next attack made against you has advantage.

Mind Surgeon.name: Mind Surgeon
Mind Surgeon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] touches one creature (which can be themself), causing that creature to regain 22 (4d10) hit points, to be cured of all diseases, or to be neutralized of all poisons affecting them (the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice).

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Sharpened Senses.name: Sharpened Senses
Sharpened Senses.description: You make a Wisdom (Perception) check to detect hidden creatures, doors, objects, or traps in your immediate surroundings, focusing your senses psionically to grant you advantage on the check.

Minor Acceleration.name: Minor Acceleration
Minor Acceleration.description: You touch a willing creature to cause their speed to increase by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

Minor Acceleration.name: Minor Acceleration
Minor Acceleration.description: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the manifester's next turn.

Psionic Bolt.name: Psionic Bolt
Psionic Bolt.description:
You shoot forth a purple beam of psychic force to strike a creature or object in range. Make a ranged power attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 force damage, and if they are Large or smaller, they are pushed 5 feet away from you.

This attack's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

The Real.name: The Real
The Real.description:
A willing creature you touch gains the ability to see things as they actually are. For the duration, the creature has &reference[truesight], automatically notices secret doors hidden by magic or psionics, and can see into the Ethereal Plane, all out to a range of 120 feet.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.TsYSrHkmAstYUYiu]{The Real} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

The Real.name: The Real
The Real.description: For the duration, you have &reference[truesight], you automatically notice secret doors hidden by magic or psionics, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane, all out to a range of 120 feet.

Psionic Resilience.name: Psionic Resilience
Psionic Resilience.description:
You touch a willing creature and give them immunity to one of the following conditions of your choice for the duration: &reference[blinded apply=false], &reference[charmed apply=false], dazed, &reference[deafened apply=false], &reference[frightened apply=false], &reference[paralyzed apply=false], &reference[petrified apply=false], &reference[poisoned apply=false], or &reference[stunned apply=false]. Additionally, if the target suffers from the chosen condition when you manifest this power, that condition is suppressed for the duration.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.V5MmuUW2RyCciHEO]{Psionic Resilience} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Psionic Resilience: Charmed.name: Psionic Resilience: Charmed
Psionic Resilience: Charmed.description: You are immune to the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Psionic Resilience: Blinded.name: Psionic Resilience: Blinded
Psionic Resilience: Blinded.description: You are immune to the &reference[blinded apply=false] condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Psionic Resilience: Dazed.name: Psionic Resilience: Dazed
Psionic Resilience: Dazed.description: You are immune to the dazed condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Psionic Resilience: Deafened.name: Psionic Resilience: Deafened
Psionic Resilience: Deafened.description: You are immune to the &reference[deafened apply=false] condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Psionic Resilience: Frightened.name: Psionic Resilience: Frightened
Psionic Resilience: Frightened.description: You are immune to the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Psionic Resilience: Paralyzed.name: Psionic Resilience: Paralyzed
Psionic Resilience: Paralyzed.description: You are immune to the &reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Psionic Resilience: Petrified.name: Psionic Resilience: Petrified
Psionic Resilience: Petrified.description: You are immune to the &reference[petrified apply=false] condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Psionic Resilience: Poisoned.name: Psionic Resilience: Poisoned
Psionic Resilience: Poisoned.description: You are immune to the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Psionic Resilience: Stunned.name: Psionic Resilience: Stunned
Psionic Resilience: Stunned.description: You are immune to the &reference[stunned apply=false] condition. Additionally, if you suffer from the chosen condition while under the effect of this power, the condition is suppressed for the duration.

Flay.name: Flay
Flay.description:
You shoot forth a 15-foot cone of pure psionic energy. Each creature in the area must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking 8d6 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.KlY3PeXOziRG6IAC]{Flay} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Beam Gaze.name: Beam Gaze
Beam Gaze.description:
You unleash a sickening beam of force at a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 7d10 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a target also suffers your choice of one of the following effects for the duration (save ends at end of turn):

  • The target is &reference[poisoned].

  • The target's speed is halved, and they can't take reactions.

  • Attack rolls against the target are made with advantage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.szBj3TYynI8mh8YH]{Beam Gaze} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Beam Gaze: Poisoned.name: Beam Gaze: Poisoned
Beam Gaze: Poisoned.description: You are &reference[poisoned apply=false] for the next minute. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Beam Gaze: Slowed.name: Beam Gaze: Slowed
Beam Gaze: Slowed.description: Your movement speed is halved, and you can't take reactions. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Beam Gaze: Marked.name: Beam Gaze: Marked
Beam Gaze: Marked.description: All attack rolls made against you are made at advantage. You may repeat the saving throw against this power at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect on a success.

Amplify.name: Amplify
Amplify.description:
You channel psionic power into the battle fury of a creature you can see within range. The next time the target hits a creature with a weapon attack during the power's duration, the attack deals an extra 3d8 psychic damage.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.ef1YKi000yMXtAuL]{Amplify} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Amplify (3rd Order).name: Amplify (3rd Order)
Amplify (3rd Order).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this power's duration, the attack deals an extra 2d8 psychic damage.

Amplify (4th Order).name: Amplify (4th Order)
Amplify (4th Order).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this power's duration, the attack deals an extra 3d8 psychic damage.

Amplify (5th Order).name: Amplify (5th Order)
Amplify (5th Order).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this power's duration, the attack deals an extra 4d8 psychic damage.

Amplify (6th Order).name: Amplify (6th Order)
Amplify (6th Order).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this power's duration, the attack deals an extra 5d8 psychic damage.

Embrace the Deep.name: Embrace the Deep
Embrace the Deep.description:
You choose up to five willing creatures you can see within range, then psionically imbue those creatures with the power to move beneath earth or water. For the duration, each creature doesn't need to breathe and gains one of the following adaptations of your choice, which must be applied to all targets:

Earth Mastery. The target has a burrowing speed equal to their walking speed.

Water Mastery. The target has a swimming speed equal to their walking speed.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.xtk0qV0Iqxgn0alo]{Embrace the Deep} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Embrace the Deep: Earth Mastery.name: Embrace the Deep: Earth Mastery
Embrace the Deep: Earth Mastery.description: For the duration of this power, you don't need to breathe and you have a burrowing speed equal to your walking speed.

Embrace the Deep: Water Mastery.name: Embrace the Deep: Water Mastery
Embrace the Deep: Water Mastery.description: For the duration of this power, you don't need to breathe and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Distant Voice.name: Distant Voice
Distant Voice.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or fewer to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if they know you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The power enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Wpc0dTKd3uAI5G82]{Distant Voice} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Cure Ailment.name: Cure Ailment
Cure Ailment.description:
You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition affecting them. The condition can be &reference[blinded apply=false], &reference[charmed apply=false], dazed, &reference[deafened apply=false], &reference[frightened apply=false], or &reference[poisoned apply=false].

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.TPP69IqlT5U7MTm0]{Cure Ailment} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Sixth Sense.name: Sixth Sense
Sixth Sense.description:
You touch a willing creature and give them one of the following senses for the duration:

  • The target gains darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

  • The target gains tremorsense out to a range of 10 feet.

  • The target can sense the presence of psionics within 30 feet of them. If the target senses psionics in this way, they can use an action to see a faint aura around each visible creature or object within 30 feet of them that bears psionic power. This sense can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.WyqGnnjUD95F0bjx]{Sixth Sense} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Sixth Sense: Darkvision.name: Sixth Sense: Darkvision
Sixth Sense: Darkvision.description: For the duration of this power, you gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

Sixth Sense: Tremorsense.name: Sixth Sense: Tremorsense
Sixth Sense: Tremorsense.description: For the duration of this power, you gain tremorsense out to a range of 10 feet.

Sixth Sense: Psionic Detection.name: Sixth Sense: Psionic Detection
Sixth Sense: Psionic Detection.description: For the duration of this power, you can sense the presence of psionics within 30 feet of you. If you sense psionics in this way, they can use an action to see a faint aura around each visible creature or object within 30 feet of them that bears psionic power. This sense can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description:
You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.GGNAETkLxGauiNhb]{Penetrating Sight} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description: You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Steel.name: Steel
Steel.description:
Your skin turns into a hard, shiny metal, granting you the following benefits for the duration:

  • You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

  • Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

  • You can take the Attack action to make up to three unarmed strikes. Each strike is a psionic melee weapon attack that uses your manifestation ability for attack rolls instead of Strength or Dexterity. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 2d10 + your manifestation ability modifier instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

  • At the start of your turn, if you have at least 1 hit point, you regain 10 hit points.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.DNkeN8ioLMAnJVPK]{Steel} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Steel.name: Steel
Steel.description:
For the duration of this power, you gain the following benefits:

  • You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

  • Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

  • You can take the Attack action to make up to three unarmed strikes. Each strike is a psionic melee weapon attack that uses your manifestation ability for attack rolls instead of Strength or Dexterity. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 2d10 + your manifestation ability modifier instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

  • At the start of your turn, if you have at least 1 hit point, you regain 10 hit points.

Read Object.name: Read Object
Read Object.description:
You touch an object and gain the following information regarding it:

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

  • You see and hear any events that have occurred within 20 feet of the object within the last 8 hours, perceiving those events from the object's perspective.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.5dYeQREPcdG5YyA7]{Read Object} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Paragon.name: Paragon
Paragon.description:
One willing creature you touch becomes a paragon of physical and mental perfection. For the duration, each of the target's ability scores is 20, unless a score is already higher.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.sdsrRXMOUPn1n6LD]{Paragon} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Paragon.name: Paragon
Paragon.description: For the duration of this power, you become a paragon of physical and mental perfection. Each of your ability scores is 20, unless a score is already higher.

Concussive Slam.name: Concussive Slam
Concussive Slam.description:
You slam a field of invisible force down upon a creature you can see within range, which must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d4 force damage and is knocked &reference[prone].

This power's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

Kinetic Crush.name: Kinetic Crush
Kinetic Crush.description:
One creature you can see within range is held in your telekinetic grip, and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 8d8 force damage and their speed becomes 0 until the start of your next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and their speed isn't reduced.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.XCJtVZLPIc5sEB2V]{Kinetic Crush} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Kinetic Crush.name: Kinetic Crush
Kinetic Crush.description: Until the start of the creature's next turn, your movement speed is reduced to 0.

Telekinetic Burst.name: Telekinetic Burst
Telekinetic Burst.description:
You unleash an explosion of mental force from a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 9d6 force damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the center of the area. On a success, a target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.GRRKLKZMvSO8SOXJ]{Telekinetic Burst} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Mass Choke.name: Mass Choke
Mass Choke.description:
You attempt to lock your enemies in your telekinetic grip. Each creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become &reference[restrained] for the duration (save ends at end of turn). A creature restrained in this way takes 5d8 force damage at the start of each of their turns. The power ends if the target is ever outside the power's range or if they have total cover from you.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.l8JXZIAQioBwbQ4P]{Mass Choke} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Mass Choke.name: Mass Choke
Mass Choke.description:
You are &reference[restrained apply=false] for the duration of this power. While choked in this way, you take [[/damage 5d8 force]] damage at the start of each of your turns.

You can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on yourself on a success.

Concussive Wave.name: Concussive Wave
Concussive Wave.description:
You send forth a rising shockwave of telekinetic power. Each creature of your choice within range must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be thrown up to 90 feet vertically and up to 30 feet away from you. Each creature is then slammed to the ground, taking 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet fallen and landing &reference[prone].

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.2eqEQtLYjzhGmDH8]{Concussive Wave} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Invisible Force.name: Invisible Force
Invisible Force.description:
When you manifest this power, pick one of the following options:

Manipulate Object. You manipulate one object with movable parts within range. For example, you could open or close a door, pull a lever, or play a few notes on a harpsichord

Move Object. Choose one object that weighs 5 pounds or less within range. You move that object up to 30 feet, including up, but not beyond the range of this power. An object moved up begins to fall as soon as that movement ends.

Object Attack. Pick one object that weighs 5 pounds or less within range, and one creature within range. You hurl the object at the creature, making a ranged power attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, depending on the nature of the object. This attack's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Shared Thoughts.name: Shared Thoughts
Shared Thoughts.description:
You choose a creature within range that you are aware of and send them a telepathic message of up to twenty five words, or a single visual image that can include no more than twenty-five words. The target can then send a message of up to twenty-five words back to you before the start of your next turn.

Your telepathic message and its response can pass through solid objects, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks them. The messages don't have to follow a straight line, and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

Fold Space.name: Fold Space
Fold Space.description:
You bend space to create a one-way pathway to a destination you select, which lasts until the end of your next turn. The opening of the pathway is a 10-foot diameter circle that appears in an unoccupied space within range. Any creature that passes through the opening is transported to the destination.

The destination you choose can be on any plane of existence. It must be known to you, though you don't need to have visited it. The power fails if you select a destination that doesn't exist, such as a place you think you know that was actually an illusion, or a familiar location that has been destroyed.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.XBOelYSnCIWS8rq1]{Fold Space} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Broadcast.name: Broadcast
Broadcast.description:
You broadcast a telepathic message to every creature of your choice that can understand a language, and which is within a specific distance you choose within range. The message lasts for 1 minute, and can include images of events that you have personally witnessed. A creature that receives the message hears your words and sees the images in their mind, though they still maintain their own senses.

You can further refine the parameters for recipients based on creature kind (for example, the message could be sent only to Humanoids, or gnolls could be excluded from receiving the message) or creatures of a particular alignment (for example, the message could be sent only to good-aligned creatures, or lawful-aligned creatures could be excluded from receiving the message).

A creature that is on another plane of existence does not receive the message.

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description:
Choose a creature within range that you can see. For the duration, you learn the surface thoughts of that creature—what is most on their mind in that moment. While reading the target's mind, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) checks made to assess or influence the target.

A creature that has an Intelligence of 3 or lower, or which doesn't speak any language, can't be targeted by this power.

Chariot of Thought.name: Chariot of Thought
Chariot of Thought.description:
A 10-foot-radius disk made of translucent psionic force springs into existence beneath your feet and lasts for the duration. The disk remains centered beneath you, and grants you a flying speed of 60 feet.

When you manifest this power, each creature and object of your choice touching the disk can be carried on the platform as it moves. The disk passes harmlessly through other creatures and objects, so that it can carry those on it past a crowd, down a narrow passageway, and so forth. The disk can hold up to nine Medium creatures, or smaller or larger creatures of equivalent size.

If the disk is above the ground when the power ends, you and any creature or object on the disk begin to fall.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 5th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.DI4leiEKid9U17ET]{Chariot of Thought} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Distant Voice.name: Distant Voice
Distant Voice.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or fewer to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if they know you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The power enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Wpc0dTKd3uAI5G82]{Distant Voice} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Extinguish.name: Extinguish
Extinguish.description:
Choose one creature, object, or psionic effect within range. Any power of 3rd order or lower on the target ends.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.bUKtjbjz8MGaEI8Q]{Extinguish} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description:
You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.GGNAETkLxGauiNhb]{Penetrating Sight} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Penetrating Sight.name: Penetrating Sight
Penetrating Sight.description: You can see into and through solid matter for the duration, out to a range of 30 feet. Solid objects within that range appear transparent to you, and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block the vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

Fulcrum.name: Fulcrum
Fulcrum.description:
By exerting your will, you can control the position of creatures and objects with ease. When you manifest this power, and as your action during any round for the duration, choose one Huge or smaller creature or object that you can see within range, which is affected as noted below. You can affect the same target round after round, choose a new target each time, or take other actions in between using this power. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by this power.

If you target a creature directly or target an object being carried or worn by a creature, the creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, or if you target an object that is not carried or worn, you move the target creature or object up to 30 feet in any direction, including up, but not beyond the range of this power. Until the end of your next turn, the target is held in your telekinetic grip, and is &reference[restrained] if it is a creature. A target lifted up is suspended in midair, and begins to fall as soon as this power no longer affects it.

On subsequent rounds, you can use your action to maintain your telekinetic grip on the target. If the target is a creature, they can repeat the saving throw to break your grip and end the power's effect on them.

As part of moving an object with this power, you can make a ranged power attack with the object against one creature in the path of its movement. If the attack hits, the target takes 5d10 bludgeoning damage from a Huge object, 4d10 bludgeoning damage from a Large object, or 3d10 bludgeoning damage from a Medium or smaller object.

You can exert fine control on objects with your telekinetic grip, such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door or a container, stowing or retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.cX1p6AeOYBtd8HYC]{Fulcrum} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Fulcrum: Telekinetic Grip.name: Fulcrum: Telekinetic Grip
Fulcrum: Telekinetic Grip.description: You are held in a telekinetic grip and are &reference[restrained]. On subsequent rounds, when the creature that manifested this power attempts to maintain their telekinetic grip, you can attempt to repeat the saving throw as an action, ending this effect on yourself.

Make Friends.name: Make Friends
Make Friends.description:
You attempt to psionically charm a Humanoid you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. If they fail the saving throw, the target is &reference[charmed] by you for the duration or until you or your companions do anything harmful to them. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance, but this doesn't mean the creature will do whatever is asked of them. When the power ends, the creature knows they were charmed by you.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.7ePlcJsrX25UA1PY]{Make Friends} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Psionic Friend.name: Psionic Friend
Psionic Friend.description: For the next hour, you are &reference[charmed apply=false] by the creature that manifested this power. While charmed, you regard the creature as a friendly acquaintance but this doesn't mean that you must do whatever is asked of you. When this power ends, you know that you were charmed by them.

Reflective Armor.name: Reflective Armor
Reflective Armor.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or a creature they can see within 30 feet of them is hit by an attack, the target of the attack gains a +[[lookup @abilities.int.mod]] bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] next turn. If the triggering attack misses, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a power attack roll (+5) against the attacker. If that attack hits, the attacker is hit by the triggering attack, which deals an extra 3 damage.

Reflected Attack.name: Reflected Attack
Reflected Attack.condition: When the telekinetic or a creature they can see within 30 feet of them is hit by an attack.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Psionic Bolt.name: Psionic Bolt
Psionic Bolt.description:
You shoot forth a purple beam of psychic force to strike a creature or object in range. Make a ranged power attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 force damage, and if they are Large or smaller, they are pushed 5 feet away from you.

This attack's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

Elsewhere.name: Elsewhere
Elsewhere.description:
You target five creatures you can see within range, then attempt to violently teleport them away. Each creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target is teleported up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, and their speed becomes 0 until the start of your next turn.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.ThLFuuGFgCEhvlMP]{Elsewhere} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Jaunt.name: Jaunt
Jaunt.description:
You bend the space of your environment for an instant, allowing you or one willing creature you touch to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. If you target another creature, they do not need to be able to see the destination.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.0U3lWvv8enI1Bmll]{Jaunt} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Momentary Lapse of Reason.name: Momentary Lapse of Reason
Momentary Lapse of Reason.description:
Choose one creature or object you can see within range. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of the target sees the target as something they greatly desire, and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature drops whatever they are holding and uses their reaction, if available, to move their speed toward the target by the most direct route. If the creature gets within 5 feet of the target, they stop moving and fall &reference[prone].

Creatures that can't be &reference[charmed apply=false] are immune to this power.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.Ivagl5xnYEXobrxq]{Momentary Lapse of Reason} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Nightmare Terrain.name: Nightmare Terrain
Nightmare Terrain.description: The ground within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is &reference[difficultterrain] for their enemies. At the start of each of the resopath's turns, they can choose up to three creatures they can see in that area, each of which takes 10 percing damage.

Reflection.name: Reflection
Reflection.description:
You choose one creature that you can see within range that has a challenge rating of 10 or lower (or that is 10th level or lower, for creatures that don't have a challenge rating), then psionically create a perfect copy of that creature. (You can copy yourself if you have access to this power at an appropriate level.)

The copy appears within an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range, and acts on your initiative count immediately after you take your turn. The copy has the same statistics as the original creature, except that they have mundane copies of the creature's equipment, and have no lair actions, legendary actions, or villain actions.

The copy reflects the original creature's current state, both physically (clean, disheveled, healthy, wounded, and so forth) and in terms of resources (current hit points, spell slots available, current strain, and so forth). The copy is loyal to you and understands the commands you give them through a mental link you share, within the bounds of their normal intellect. They disappear when they are reduced to 0 hit points.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.9ty8fC2RSI5nB62B]{Reflection} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Fold Space.name: Fold Space
Fold Space.description:
You bend space to create a one-way pathway to a destination you select, which lasts until the end of your next turn. The opening of the pathway is a 10-foot diameter circle that appears in an unoccupied space within range. Any creature that passes through the opening is transported to the destination.

The destination you choose can be on any plane of existence. It must be known to you, though you don't need to have visited it. The power fails if you select a destination that doesn't exist, such as a place you think you know that was actually an illusion, or a familiar location that has been destroyed.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 6th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.XBOelYSnCIWS8rq1]{Fold Space} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Reminisce.name: Reminisce
Reminisce.description:
With this power, you attempt to manipulate a creature using their memories and emotions. One creature within range that you can see must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. On a failed save, the target believes that a friend or loved one has approached them and wishes to have a pleasant conversation. The target stops whatever they are doing, taking no actions while they engage in a conversation with the imaginary acquaintance for the duration.

The target can repeat the saving throw if they take damage, or if another creature uses an action to point out that the target isn't having a conversation with a real person, ending the effect on themself on a success. A creature that can't be &reference[charmed apply=false] is immune to this power.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.cBxGKyT55vuUKISF]{Reminisce} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Reminiscing.name: Reminiscing
Reminiscing.description:
For the duration of this effect, you believe that a friend or loved one has approached you and wishes to have a pleasant conversation. You stop whatever you are doing, taking no actions while you engage in a conversation with the acquaintance.

If you take damage or another creature uses an action to point out that the acquaintance you are having a conversation with is not a real person, you may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

Memory Gap.name: Memory Gap
Memory Gap.description:
By manipulating time, you attempt to erase another creature's memories. One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. On a failure, you can erase the target's memory of an event that they experienced within the last 24 hours and that lasted no more than 10 minutes, permanently eliminating all memory of the event. You do not need to have witnessed the event, but must be aware of the event and its details in some way, even as a second-hand account. Once the memory is erased, the target can't recall what happened to them during that time, but they are unbothered by the hole in their recollection.

Any creature that can sense psionics, such as one under the influence of the sixth sense power, can tell the target has had their memory modified. The cure ailment power manifested on the target restores the creature's memory.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.VkJqUgtd2n5bz5PU]{Memory Gap} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Adapt.name: Adapt
Adapt.description:
Choose up to four willing creatures you can see within range. For the duration, each target can survive without any food or water, and is immune to exhaustion caused by mundane environmental or weather effects.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.OSbTviaBTOEA7qR5]{Adapt} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Adapted.name: Adapted
Adapted.description: For the duration of this power, you can survive without any food or water, and you are immune to exhaustion caused by mundane environmental or weather effects.

Extinguish.name: Extinguish
Extinguish.description:
Choose one creature, object, or psionic effect within range. Any power of 3rd order or lower on the target ends.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.bUKtjbjz8MGaEI8Q]{Extinguish} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Guise.name: Guise
Guise.description:
You project a psionic appearance over your own body, transforming yourself into any creature you have encountered that is your size, though none of your statistics change. You can also change the appearance of any gear you wear or hold when you manifest this power.

Your changed appearance fails to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this power to become a mastiff, any object passing directly over the image of the mastiff will bump into you while seemingly in midair, and anyone who pets the mastiff would feel your body.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use an action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your talent power save DC.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.FQvVmMjtBidvc3L1]{Guise} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Psionic Guise.name: Psionic Guise
Psionic Guise.description:
You have projected a psionic appearance over your own body, transforming yourself into any creature you have encountered that is your size, though none of your statistics change. You can also change the appearance of any gear you wear or hold when you manifest this power.

Your changed appearance fails to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this power to become a mastiff, any object passing directly over the image of the mastiff will bump into you while seemingly in midair, and anyone who pets the mastiff would feel your body.

Psionic Guise: Grow.name: Psionic Guise: Grow
Psionic Guise: Grow.description: Your size category increases by one size, your size doubles in all dimensions, and your weight is multiplied by eight. If there isn't enough room for you to grow appropriately, you attain the maximum possible size in the space available. You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Any weapons that grow with you deal an extra 1d4 damage per size category they grow.

Psionic Guise: Shrink.name: Psionic Guise: Shrink
Psionic Guise: Shrink.description: You become one size category smaller. For each size category smaller you become, your size is halved in all dimensions and your weight is divided by 8. You have disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Any weapons that shrink with you reduce their damage by 1d4 per size category they shrink (to a minimum 1 damage).

Stasis Field.name: Stasis Field
Stasis Field.description:
You shape a translucent 20-foot cube originating from you, within which you control the effects of time to make objects immune from harm. For the duration, objects in the cube when it appears that aren't worn or carried by a creature can't be moved, damaged, or destroyed. If part of an object is inside the cube and part of it is outside, the part that is outside can be damaged.

You and any creatures in the cube when it appears can move through it freely, and can cast spells and manifest powers through the cube. All other creatures, spells, powers, and supernatural effects are barred from passing through the cube.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.uWUiRJ2o7KzcjcNq]{Stasis Field} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Restructure.name: Restructure
Restructure.description:
You touch a Large or smaller mundane object to set up psionic vibrations within it, altering the material it is made out of (from metal to stone, from wood to glass, and so forth). You can't change the object's state—gas, liquid, or solid—and you can't increase its value. For example, if you turn a silver statue into a gold statue, the gold is of such poor quality that the statue's worth remains the same.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.jHG9QmBtcRB2uvFV]{Restructure} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

affects.special: A large or smaller mundane object.

Apparition.name: Apparition
Apparition.description: You create a sound or an image that only you and one creature within range perceive. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a creature's roar, a musical instrument, or any other sound you choose. If you create an image, it must fit within a 5-foot cube and can't move. The image can't create any effect that influences a sense other than sight. The image disappears if the perceiving creature touches it.

Rewrite.name: Rewrite
Rewrite.description: You bend a small portion of reality to target a Tiny mundane object within range that isn't carried or worn by another creature. For the duration, that object is transformed into another Tiny mundane object of your choice, which must be of the same or lesser value as the original.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Dagger of the Mind.name: Dagger of the Mind
Dagger of the Mind.description:
You lash out with your mind to psychically damage a creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 4d10 psychic damage and can take only the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge actions on their next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and can take their turn normally.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 3rd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.TIFu2wUE02jwliXE]{Dagger of the Mind} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Daggers of the Mind.name: Daggers of the Mind
Daggers of the Mind.description: During your next turn, you can only take the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge actions.

Harlequin.name: Harlequin
Harlequin.description:
You psionically grasp for control of the mind of one Humanoid you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting them. On a successful save, you can choose to deal 3d10 psychic damage to the target. On a failed save, the target is &reference[charmed] by you for the duration .

While the target is charmed in this way, you have a telepathic link with them as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the target (no action required), which they do their best to obey. If the target completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from you, they defend and preserve themself to the best of their ability.

You can use an action to take total and precise control of a charmed target. Until the end of your next turn, the target takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything else. During this time, you can also cause the target to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, they make a new Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw succeeds, the charmed condition ends.

Increased Order. When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 2 to target a creature other than a Humanoid.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 4th-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.KSxCbHYSBVBLcWpx]{Harlequin} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Harlequin.name: Harlequin
Harlequin.description:
You are &reference[charmed apply=false] by the creature that manifested this power. While charmed, you share a telepathic link with them as long as t he two of you are on the same plane of existence. They can use this telepathic link to issue commands to you, which you must do your best to obey. If you complete an order and don't receive further directions from them, you defend and preserve yourself to the best of your ability.

Each time you take damage, you make a new Wisdom saving throw, ending this effect on a success.

Influence.name: Influence
Influence.description:
Choose one creature within range, then make a Charisma check to influence or entertain that creature, making use of appropriate skills as the GM allows. Touching the mind of the target grants you advantage on the check, which carries no additional supernatural power.

If you fail the check, the creature realizes that you attempted to use psionics to influence their mood, and becomes hostile toward you. A creature prone to violence might attack you. Another creature might seek retribution in other ways at the GM's discretion, depending on the nature of your interaction with them.

Creatures that can't be &reference[charmed apply=false] are immune to this effect.

Rewrite.description: You bend a small portion of reality to target a Tiny mundane object within range that isn't carried or worn by another creature. For the duration, that object is transformed into another Tiny mundane object of your choice, which must be of the same or lesser value as the original.

Psychic Stab.name: Psychic Stab
Psychic Stab.description:
One creature you can see within range must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d10 psychic damage.

This attack's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

Read Object.name: Read Object
Read Object.description:
You touch an object and gain the following information regarding it:

  • You receive a mental image of the last creature to hold the object.

  • You see and hear any events that have occurred within 20 feet of the object within the last 8 hours, perceiving those events from the object's perspective.

Increased Order. When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1. When you do so, you can place an invisible psionic sensor on the object that lasts for 24 hours. For the duration, you can use an action to learn the object's distance and direction relative to you, and to see and hear the object's surroundings from its point of view as if you were there.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.5dYeQREPcdG5YyA7]{Read Object} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

Share Pain.name: Share Pain
Share Pain.description:
You psionically reach out toward the creature that damaged you, letting them share your pain. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 1d12 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Foundry Note

This power has been modified for this creature's statblock. The base 2nd-Order version of @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.features.Item.t4JVzc1hgSr5MYUw]{Share Pain} is linked here for the purposes of Player Talents learning this power.

activation.condition: In response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see
